verses.en: So when you see standing in the holy place 'the abomination that causes desolation,' spoken of through the prophet Daniel—let the reader understand—

verses.zh: 那时，在犹太的，应当逃到山上；
verses.en: then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

verses.zh: 在房上的，不要下来拿家里的东西；
verses.en: Let no one on the housetop go down to take anything out of the house.

verses.zh: 在田里的，也不要回去取衣裳。
verses.en: Let no one in the field go back to get their cloak.

verses.zh: 当那些日子，怀孕的和奶孩子的有祸了！
verses.en: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!

verses.zh: 你们应当祈求，叫你们逃跑的时候，不遇见冬天或是安息日。
verses.en: Pray that your flight will not take place in winter or on the Sabbath.

verses.zh: 因为那时必有大灾难，从世界的起头直到如今，没有这样的灾难，后来也必没有。
verses.en: For then there will be great distress, unequaled from the beginning of the world until now—and never to be equaled again.

verses.zh: 若不减少那日子，凡有血气的总没有一个得救的；只是为选民，那日子必减少了。
verses.en: If those days had not been cut short, no one would survive, but for the sake of the elect those days will be shortened.

verses.zh: 那时，若有人对你们说：基督在这里，或说：基督在那里，你们不要信！
verses.en: At that time if anyone says to you, 'Look, here is the Messiah!' or, 'There he is!' do not believe it.

verses.zh: 因为假基督、假先知将要起来，显大神迹大奇事，倒能迷惑选民。（倒能：或作几乎能）
verses.en: For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform great signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.

verses.zh: 看哪，我预先告诉你们了。
verses.en: See, I have told you ahead of time.

verses.zh: 若有人对你们说：看哪，基督在旷野里，你们不要出去！或说：看哪，基督在内屋中，你们不要信！
verses.en: So if anyone tells you, 'There he is, out in the wilderness,' do not go out; or, 'Here he is, in the inner rooms,' do not believe it.

verses.zh: 闪电从东边发出，直照到西边；人子降临也要这样。
verses.en: For as lightning that comes from the east is visible even in the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

verses.zh: 尸首在哪里，鹰也必聚在那里。
verses.en: Wherever there is a carcass, there the vultures will gather.

verses.zh: '那些日子的灾难一过，日头就变黑了，月亮也不放光，众星要从天上坠落，天势都要震动。
verses.en: Immediately after the distress of those days 'the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.'

verses.zh: 那时，人子的兆头要显在天上，地上的万族都要哀哭。他们要看见人子，有能力，有大荣耀，驾着天上的云降临。
verses.en: Then will appear the sign of the Son of Man in heaven. And then all the peoples of the earth will mourn when they see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven, with power and great glory.

verses.zh: 他要差遣使者，用号筒的大声，将他的选民，从四方（四方：原文是四风），从天这边到天那边，都招聚了来。
verses.en: And he will send his angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from one end of the heavens to the other.

verses.zh: '你们可以从无花果树学个比方：当树枝发嫩长叶的时候，你们就知道夏天近了。
verses.en: Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.

verses.zh: 这样，你们看见这一切的事，也该知道人子近了，正在门口了。
verses.en: Even so, when you see all these things, you know that it is near, right at the door.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，这世代还没有过去，这些事都要成就。
verses.en: Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.

verses.zh: 天地要废去，我的话却不能废去。
verses.en: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

verses.zh: '但那日子，那时辰，没有人知道，连天上的使者也不知道，惟独我父知道。
verses.en: But about that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

verses.zh: 挪亚的日子怎样，人子降临也要怎样。
verses.en: As it was in the days of Noah, so it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.

verses.zh: 当洪水以前的日子，人照常吃喝嫁娶，直到挪亚进方舟的那日；
verses.en: For in the days before the flood, people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, up to the day Noah entered the ark;

verses.zh: 不知不觉洪水来了，把他们全都冲去。人子降临也要这样。
verses.en: and they knew nothing about what would happen until the flood came and took them all away. That is how it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.

verses.zh: 那时，两个人在田里，取去一个，留下一个。
verses.en: Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left.

verses.zh: 两个女人推磨，取去一个，留下一个。
verses.en: Two women will be grinding with a hand mill; one will be taken and the other left.

verses.zh: 所以，你们要儆醒，因为不知道你们的主是哪一天来到。
verses.en: Therefore keep watch, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.

verses.zh: 家主若知道几更天有贼来，就必儆醒，不容人挖透房屋；这是你们所知道的。
verses.en: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what time of night the thief was coming, he would have kept watch and would not have let his house be broken into.

verses.zh: 所以，你们也要预备，因为你们想不到的时候，人子就来了。
verses.en: So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.

verses.zh: '谁是忠心有见识的仆人，为主人所派，管理家里的人，按时分粮给他们呢？
verses.en: Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom the master has put in charge of the servants in his household to give them their food at the proper time?

verses.zh: 主人来到，看见他这样行，那仆人就有福了。
verses.en: It will be good for that servant whose master finds him doing so when he returns.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，主人要派他管理一切所有的。
verses.en: Truly I tell you, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.

verses.zh: 如果那恶仆心里说：我的主人必来得迟，
verses.en: But suppose that servant is wicked and says to himself, 'My master is staying away a long time,'

verses.zh: 就动手打他的同伴，又和醉酒的人一同吃喝。
verses.en: and he then begins to beat his fellow servants and to eat and drink with drunkards.

verses.zh: 在想不到的日子，不知道的时辰，那仆人的主人要来，
verses.en: The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of.

verses.zh: 重重地处治他（或作：把他腰斩了），定他和假善人同罪；在那里必要哀哭切齿了。'
verses.en: He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

verses.zh: 安息日将尽，七日的头一日，天快亮的时候，抹大拉的马利亚和那个马利亚来看坟墓。
verses.en: After the Sabbath, at dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to look at the tomb.

verses.zh: 忽然，地大震动；因为有主的使者从天上下来，把石头滚开，坐在上面。
verses.en: There was a violent earthquake, for an angel of the Lord came down from heaven and, going to the tomb, rolled back the stone and sat on it.

verses.zh: 他的像貌如同闪电，衣服洁白如雪。
verses.en: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothes were white as snow.

verses.zh: 看守的人就因他吓得浑身乱战，甚至和死人一样。
verses.en: The guards were so afraid of him that they shook and became like dead men.

verses.zh: 天使对妇女说：不要害怕！我知道你们是寻找那钉十字架的耶稣。
verses.en: The angel said to the women, 'Do not be afraid, for I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.

verses.zh: 他不在这里，照他所说的，已经复活了。你们来看安放主的地方。
verses.en: He is not here; he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where he lay.

verses.zh: 快去告诉他的门徒，说他从死里复活了，并且在你们以先往加利利去，在那里你们要见他。看哪，我已经告诉你们了。
verses.en: Then go quickly and tell his disciples: 'He has risen from the dead and is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him.' Now I have told you.

verses.zh: 妇女们就急忙离开坟墓，又害怕，又大大地欢喜，跑去要报给他的门徒。
verses.en: So the women hurried away from the tomb, afraid yet filled with joy, and ran to tell his disciples.

verses.zh: 忽然，耶稣遇见她们，说：愿你们平安！她们就上前抱住他的脚拜他。
verses.en: Suddenly Jesus met them. 'Greetings,' he said. They came to him, clasped his feet and worshiped him.

verses.zh: 耶稣对她们说：不要害怕！你们去告诉我的弟兄，叫他们往加利利去，在那里必见我。
verses.en: Then Jesus said to them, 'Do not be afraid. Go and tell my brothers to go to Galilee; there they will see me.'

verses.zh: 她们去的时候，看守的兵有几个进城去，将所经历的事都报给祭司长。
verses.en: While the women were on their way, some of the guards went into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had happened.

verses.zh: 祭司长和长老聚集商议，就拿许多银钱给兵丁，
verses.en: When the chief priests had met with the elders and devised a plan, they gave the soldiers a large sum of money,

verses.zh: 说：你们要这样说：夜间我们睡觉的时候，他的门徒来，把他偷去了。
verses.en: telling them, 'You are to say, 'His disciples came during the night and stole him away while we were asleep.'

verses.zh: 倘若这话被巡抚听见，有我们劝他，保你们无事。
verses.en: If this report gets to the governor, we will satisfy him and keep you out of trouble.

verses.zh: 兵丁受了银钱，就照所嘱咐他们的去行。这话就传说在犹太人中间，直到今日。
verses.en: So the soldiers took the money and did as they were instructed. And this story has been widely circulated among the Jews to this very day.

verses.zh: 十一个门徒往加利利去，到了耶稣约定他们的山上。
verses.en: Then the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.

verses.zh: 他们见了耶稣就拜他，然而还有人疑惑。
verses.en: When they saw him, they worshiped him; but some doubted.

verses.zh: 耶稣进前来，对他们说：天上地下所有的权柄都赐给我了。
verses.en: Then Jesus came to them and said, 'All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.

verses.zh: 所以，你们要去，使万民作我的门徒，奉父、子、圣灵的名给他们施洗。
verses.en: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

verses.zh: 凡我所吩咐你们的，都教训他们遵守，我就常与你们同在，直到世界的末了。
verses.en: and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.

verses.zh: 耶稣见许多人围着他，就吩咐渡到那边去。
verses.en: When Jesus saw the crowd around him, he gave orders to cross to the other side of the lake.

verses.zh: 有一个文士来，对他说：'夫子，你无论往哪里去，我要跟从你。'
verses.en: Then a teacher of the law came to him and said, 'Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'狐狸有洞，天空的飞鸟有窝，人子却没有枕头的地方。'
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'Foxes have dens and birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.'

verses.zh: 又有一个门徒对耶稣说：'主啊，容我先回去埋葬我的父亲。'
verses.en: Another disciple said to him, 'Lord, first let me go and bury my father.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'任凭死人埋葬他们的死人；你跟从我吧！'
verses.en: But Jesus told him, 'Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.'

verses.zh: 耶稣上了船，门徒跟着他。
verses.en: Then he got into the boat and his disciples followed him.

verses.zh: 海里忽然起了暴风，甚至船被波浪掩盖；耶稣却睡着了。
verses.en: Suddenly a furious storm came up on the lake, so that the waves swept over the boat. But Jesus was sleeping.

verses.zh: 门徒来叫醒了他，说：'主啊，救我们，我们丧命啦！'
verses.en: The disciples went and woke him, saying, 'Lord, save us! We're going to drown!'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们这小信的人哪，为什么胆怯呢？'于是起来，斥责风和海，风和海就大大地平静了。
verses.en: He replied, 'You of little faith, why are you so afraid?' Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the waves, and it was completely calm.

verses.zh: 众人希奇，说：'这是怎样的人？连风和海也听从他了！'
verses.en: The men were amazed and asked, 'What kind of man is this? Even the winds and the waves obey him!'

verses.zh: 耶稣既渡到那边去，来到加大拉人的地方，就有两个被鬼附的人从坟茔里出来迎着他，极其凶猛，甚至没有人能从那条路上经过。
verses.en: When he arrived at the other side in the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men coming from the tombs met him. They were so violent that no one could pass that way.

verses.zh: 他们喊着说：'神的儿子，我们与你有什么相干？时候还没有到，你就上这里来叫我们受苦吗？'
verses.en: 'What do you want with us, Son of God?' they shouted. 'Have you come here to torture us before the appointed time?'

verses.zh: 离他们很远，有一大群猪吃食。
verses.en: Some distance from them a large herd of pigs was feeding.

verses.zh: 鬼就央求耶稣，说：'若把我们赶出去，就打发我们进入猪群吧！'
verses.en: The demons begged Jesus, 'If you drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'去吧！'鬼就出来，进入猪群。全群忽然闯下山崖，投在海里淹死了。
verses.en: He said to them, 'Go!' So they came out and went into the pigs, and the whole herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and died in the water.

verses.zh: 放猪的就逃跑进城，将这一切事和被鬼附的人所遇见的都告诉人。
verses.en: Those tending the pigs ran off, went into the town and reported all this, including what had happened to the demon-possessed men.

verses.zh: 合城的人都出来迎见耶稣，既见了就央求他离开他们的境界。
verses.en: Then the whole town went out to meet Jesus. And when they saw him, they pleaded with him to leave their region.

verses.zh: 那时，耶稣在安息日从麦地经过。他的门徒饿了，就掐起麦穗来吃。
verses.en: At that time Jesus went through the grainfields on the Sabbath. His disciples were hungry and began to pick some heads of grain and eat them.

verses.zh: 法利赛人看见，就对耶稣说：'看哪，你的门徒做安息日不可做的事了！'
verses.en: When the Pharisees saw this, they said to him, 'Look! Your disciples are doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath.'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'经上记着大卫和跟从他的人饥饿之时所做的事，你们没有念过吗？
verses.en: He answered, 'Haven't you read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?

verses.zh: 他怎么进了神的殿，吃了陈设饼，这饼不是他和跟从他的人可以吃得，惟独祭司才可以吃。
verses.en: He entered the house of God, and he and his companions ate the consecrated bread—which was not lawful for them to do, but only for the priests.

verses.zh: 再者，律法上所记的，当安息日，祭司在殿里犯了安息日还是没有罪，你们没有念过吗？
verses.en: Or haven't you read in the Law that the priests on Sabbath duty in the temple desecrate the Sabbath and yet are innocent?

verses.zh: 但我告诉你们，在这里有一人比殿更大。
verses.en: I tell you that something greater than the temple is here.

verses.zh: '我喜爱怜恤，不喜爱祭祀。'你们若明白这话的意思，就不将无罪的当作有罪的了。
verses.en: If you had known what these words mean, 'I desire mercy, not sacrifice,' you would not have condemned the innocent.

verses.zh: 因为人子是安息日的主。'
verses.en: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.'

verses.zh: 耶稣离开那地方，进了一个会堂。
verses.en: Going on from that place, he went into their synagogue,

verses.zh: 那里有一个人枯干了一只手。有人问耶稣说：'安息日治病可以不可以？'意思是要控告他。
verses.en: and a man with a shriveled hand was there. Looking for a reason to bring charges against Jesus, they asked him, 'Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们中间谁有一只羊，当安息日掉在坑里，不把它抓住，拉上来呢？
verses.en: He said to them, 'If any of you has a sheep and it falls into a pit on the Sabbath, will you not take hold of it and lift it out?

verses.zh: 人比羊何等贵重呢！所以，在安息日做善事是可以的。'
verses.en: How much more valuable is a person than a sheep! Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.'

verses.zh: 于是对那人说：'伸出手来！'他把手一伸，手就复了原，和那只手一样。
verses.en: Then he said to the man, 'Stretch out your hand.' So he stretched it out and it was completely restored, just as sound as the other.

verses.zh: 法利赛人出去，商议怎样可以除灭耶稣。
verses.en: But the Pharisees went out and plotted how they might kill Jesus.

verses.zh: 耶稣知道了，就离开那里，有许多人跟着他。他把其中有病的人都治好了，
verses.en: Aware of this, Jesus withdrew from that place. A large crowd followed him, and he healed all who were ill.

verses.zh: 又嘱咐他们，不要给他传名。
verses.en: He warned them not to tell others about him.

verses.zh: 这是要应验先知以赛亚的话，说：
verses.en: This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah:

verses.zh: '看哪！我的仆人，我所拣选、所亲爱、心里所喜悦的，我要将我的灵赐给他；他必将公理传给外邦。
verses.en: 'Here is my servant whom I have chosen, the one I love, in whom I delight; I will put my Spirit on him, and he will proclaim justice to the nations.

verses.zh: 他不争竞，不喧嚷，街上也没有人听见他的声音。
verses.en: He will not quarrel or cry out; no one will hear his voice in the streets.

verses.zh: 压伤的芦苇，他不折断；将残的灯火，他不吹灭；等他施行公理，叫公理得胜。
verses.en: A bruised reed he will not break, and a smoldering wick he will not snuff out, till he has brought justice through to victory.

verses.zh: 外邦人都要仰望他的名。'
verses.en: In his name the nations will put their hope.'

verses.zh: 当下，有人将一个被鬼附着、又瞎又哑的人带到耶稣那里，耶稣就医治他，甚至那哑巴又能说话，又能看见。
verses.en: Then they brought him a demon-possessed man who was blind and mute, and Jesus healed him, so that he could both talk and see.

verses.zh: 众人都惊奇，说：'这不是大卫的子孙吗？'
verses.en: All the people were astonished and said, 'Could this be the Son of David?'

verses.zh: 但法利赛人听见，就说：'这个人赶鬼，无非是靠着鬼王别西卜啊。'
verses.en: But when the Pharisees heard this, they said, 'It is only by Beelzebul, the prince of demons, that this fellow drives out demons.'

verses.zh: 耶稣知道他们的意念，就对他们说：'凡一国自相纷争，就成为荒场；一城一家自相纷争，必站立不住。
verses.en: Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them, 'Every kingdom divided against itself will be ruined, and every city or household divided against itself will not stand.

verses.zh: 若撒但赶逐撒但，就是自相纷争，他的国怎能站得住呢？
verses.en: If Satan drives out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then can his kingdom stand?

verses.zh: 我若靠着别西卜赶鬼，你们的子弟赶鬼又靠着谁呢？这样，他们就要断定你们的是非。
verses.en: And if I drive out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your people drive them out? So then, they will be your judges.

verses.zh: 我若靠着神的灵赶鬼，这就是神的国临到你们了。
verses.en: But if it is by the Spirit of God that I drive out demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.

verses.zh: 人怎能进壮士家里，抢夺他的家具呢？除非先捆住那壮士，才可以抢夺他的家财。
verses.en: Or again, how can anyone enter a strong man's house and carry off his possessions unless he first ties up the strong man? Then he can plunder his house.

verses.zh: 不与我相合的，就是敌我的；不同我收聚的，就是分散的。
verses.en: Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.

verses.zh: 所以我告诉你们：人一切的罪和亵渎的话都可得赦免，惟独亵渎圣灵，总不得赦免。
verses.en: And so I tell you, every kind of sin and slander can be forgiven, but blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven.

verses.zh: 凡说话干犯人子的，还可得赦免；惟独说话干犯圣灵的，今世来世总不得赦免。
verses.en: Anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but anyone who speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the age to come.

verses.zh: 你们或以为树好，果子也好；树坏，果子也坏；因为看果子就可以知道树。
verses.en: Make a tree good and its fruit will be good, or make a tree bad and its fruit will be bad, for a tree is recognized by its fruit.

verses.zh: 毒蛇的种类！你们既是恶人，怎能说出好话来呢？因为心里所充满的，口里就说出来。
verses.en: You brood of vipers, how can you who are evil say anything good? For the mouth speaks what the heart is full of.

verses.zh: 善人从他心里所存的善就发出善来；恶人从他心里所存的恶就发出恶来。
verses.en: A good man brings good things out of the good stored up in him, and an evil man brings evil things out of the evil stored up in him.

verses.zh: 我又告诉你们：凡人所说的闲话，当审判的日子，必要句句供出来。
verses.en: But I tell you that everyone will have to give account on the day of judgment for every empty word they have spoken.

verses.zh: 因为要凭你的话定你为义，也要凭你的话定你有罪。'
verses.en: For by your words you will be acquitted, and by your words you will be condemned.'

verses.zh: 当时，有几个文士和法利赛人对耶稣说：'夫子，我们愿意看你显个神迹。'
verses.en: Then some of the Pharisees and teachers of the law said to him, 'Teacher, we want to see a sign from you.'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'一个邪恶淫乱的世代求神迹，除了先知约拿的神迹以外，再没有神迹给他们看。
verses.en: He answered, 'A wicked and adulterous generation asks for a sign! But none will be given it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.

verses.zh: 约拿三日三夜在大鱼腹中，人子也要这样三日三夜在地里头。
verses.en: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of a huge fish, so the Son of Man will be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

verses.zh: 当审判的时候，尼尼微人要起来定这世代的罪，因为尼尼微人听了约拿所传的就悔改了。看哪！在这里有一人比约拿更大。
verses.en: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it; for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and now something greater than Jonah is here.

verses.zh: 当审判的时候，南方的女王要起来定这世代的罪，因为她从地极而来，要听所罗门的智慧话。看哪！在这里有一人比所罗门更大。
verses.en: The Queen of the South will rise at the judgment with this generation and condemn it; for she came from the ends of the earth to listen to Solomon's wisdom, and now something greater than Solomon is here.

verses.zh: 污鬼离了人身，就在无水之地过来过去，寻求安歇之处，却寻不着。
verses.en: When an impure spirit comes out of a person, it goes through arid places seeking rest and does not find it.

verses.zh: 于是说：我要回到我所出来的屋里。到了，就看见里面空闲，打扫干净，修饰好了，
verses.en: Then it says, 'I will return to the house I left.' When it arrives, it finds the house unoccupied, swept clean and put in order.

verses.zh: 便去另带了七个比自己更恶的鬼来，都进去住在那里。那人末后的景况比先前更不好了。这邪恶的世代也要如此。'
verses.en: Then it goes and takes with it seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they go in and live there. And the final condition of that person is worse than the first. That is how it will be with this wicked generation.'

verses.zh: 耶稣还对众人说话的时候，不料他母亲和他弟兄站在外边，要与他说话。
verses.en: While Jesus was still talking to the crowd, his mother and brothers stood outside, wanting to speak to him.

verses.zh: 有人告诉他说：'看哪，你母亲和你弟兄站在外边，要与你说话。'
verses.en: Someone told him, 'Your mother and brothers are standing outside, wanting to speak to you.'

verses.zh: 他却回答那人说：'谁是我的母亲？谁是我的弟兄？'
verses.en: He replied to him, 'Who is my mother, and who are my brothers?'

verses.zh: 就伸手指着门徒，说：'看哪，我的母亲，我的弟兄。
verses.en: Pointing to his disciples, he said, 'Here are my mother and my brothers.

verses.zh: 凡遵行我天父旨意的人，就是我的弟兄姐妹和母亲了。'
verses.en: For whoever does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother.'

verses.zh: 当那一天，耶稣从房子里出来，坐在海边。
verses.en: That same day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the lake.

verses.zh: 有许多人到他那里聚集，他只得上船坐下，众人都站在岸上。
verses.en: Such large crowds gathered around him that he got into a boat and sat in it, while all the people stood on the shore.

verses.zh: 他用比喻对他们讲许多道理，说：'有一个撒种的出去撒种。
verses.en: Then he told them many things in parables, saying: 'A farmer went out to sow his seed.

verses.zh: 撒的时候，有落在路旁的，飞鸟来吃尽了。
verses.en: As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it up.

verses.zh: 有落在土浅石头地上的，土既不深，发芽甚快，
verses.en: Some fell on rocky places, where it did not have much soil. It sprang up quickly, because the soil was shallow.

verses.zh: 日头出来一晒，因为没有根，就枯干了。
verses.en: But when the sun came up, the plants were scorched, and they withered because they had no root.

verses.zh: 有落在荚棘里的，荚棘长起来，把它挤住了。
verses.en: Other seed fell among thorns, which grew up and choked the plants.

verses.zh: 又有落在好土里的，就结实，有一百倍的，有六十倍的，有三十倍的。
verses.en: Still other seed fell on good soil, where it produced a crop—a hundred, sixty or thirty times what was sown.

verses.zh: 有耳可听的，就应当听！'
verses.en: Whoever has ears, let them hear.'

verses.zh: 门徒进前来，问耶稣说：'对众人讲话，为什么用比喻呢？'
verses.en: The disciples came to him and asked, 'Why do you speak to the people in parables?'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'因为天国的奥秘，只叫你们知道，不叫他们知道。
verses.en: He replied, 'Because the knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of heaven has been given to you, but not to them.

verses.zh: 凡有的，还要加给他，叫他有余；凡没有的，连他所有的也要夺去。
verses.en: Whoever has will be given more, and they will have an abundance. Whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.

verses.zh: 所以我用比喻对他们讲，是因他们看也看不见，听也听不见，也不明白。
verses.en: This is why I speak to them in parables: 'Though seeing, they do not see; though hearing, they do not hear or understand.'

verses.zh: 在他们身上，正应验了以赛亚的预言，说：你们听是要听见，却不明白；看是要看见，却不晓得。
verses.en: In them is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah: 'You will be ever hearing but never understanding; you will be ever seeing but never perceiving.'

verses.zh: 因为这百姓油蒙了心，耳朵发沉，眼睛闭着；恐怕眼睛看见，耳朵听见，心里明白，回转过来，我就医治他们。
verses.en: For this people's heart has become calloused; they hardly hear with their ears, and they have closed their eyes. Otherwise they might see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts and turn, and I would heal them.'

verses.zh: 但你们的眼睛是有福的，因为看得见；你们的耳朵也是有福的，因为听得见。
verses.en: But blessed are your eyes because they see, and your ears because they hear.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们：从前有许多先知和义人要看你们所看的，却没有看见；要听你们所听的，却没有听见。
verses.en: For truly I tell you, many prophets and righteous people longed to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.

verses.zh: 所以，你们当听这撒种的比喻。
verses.en: Listen then to what the parable of the sower means:

verses.zh: 凡听见天国道理不明白的，那恶者就来，把所撒在他心里的夺去。这就是撒在路旁的了。
verses.en: When anyone hears the message about the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away what was sown in their heart. This is the seed sown along the path.

verses.zh: 撒在石头地上的，就是人听了道，当下欢喜领受，
verses.en: The seed falling on rocky ground refers to someone who hears the word and at once receives it with joy.

verses.zh: 只因心里没有根，不过是暂时的，及至为道遇了患难，或是受了逼迫，立刻就跌倒了。
verses.en: But since they have no root, they last only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the word, they quickly fall away.

verses.zh: 撒在荚棘里的，就是人听了道，后来有世上的思虑、钱财的迷惑把道挤住了，不能结实。
verses.en: The seed falling among the thorns refers to someone who hears the word, but the worries of this life and the deceitfulness of wealth choke the word, making it unfruitful.

verses.zh: 撒在好地上的，就是人听道明白了，后来结实，有一百倍的，有六十倍的，有三十倍的。'
verses.en: But the seed falling on good soil refers to someone who hears the word and understands it. This is the one who produces a crop, yielding a hundred, sixty or thirty times what was sown.'

verses.zh: 耶稣又设个比喻对他们说：'天国好像人撒好种在田里，
verses.en: Jesus told them another parable: 'The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.

verses.zh: 及至人睡觉的时候，有仙敌来，将稗子撒在麦子里就走了。
verses.en: But while everyone was sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat, and went away.

verses.zh: 到长苗吐穗的时候，稗子也显出来。
verses.en: When the wheat sprouted and formed heads, then the weeds also appeared.

verses.zh: 田主的仆人来告诉他说：主啊，你不是撒好种在田里吗？从哪里来的稗子呢？
verses.en: The owner's servants came to him and said, 'Sir, didn't you sow good seed in your field? Where then did the weeds come from?'

verses.zh: 主人说：这是仙敌做的。仆人说：你要我们去薨出来吗？
verses.en: 'An enemy did this,' he replied. The servants asked him, 'Do you want us to go and pull them up?'

verses.zh: 主人说：不必，恐怕薨稗子，连麦子也拔出来。
verses.en: 'No,' he answered, 'because while you are pulling the weeds, you may uproot the wheat with them.

verses.zh: 容这两样一齐长，等到收割的时候，我要对收割的人说，先将稗子薨出来，捣成捷，留着烧；惟有麦子要收在仓里。'
verses.en: Let both grow together until the harvest. At that time I will tell the harvesters: First collect the weeds and tie them in bundles to be burned; then gather the wheat and bring it into my barn.'

verses.zh: 他又设个比喻对他们说：'天国好像一粒芝麻籽，有人拿去种在田里。
verses.en: He told them another parable: 'The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his field.

verses.zh: 这原是百种里最小的，及至长起来，却比各样的菜都大，且成了树，天上的飞鸟来宿在它的枝上。'
verses.en: Though it is the smallest of all seeds, yet when it grows, it is the largest of garden plants and becomes a tree, so that the birds come and perch in its branches.'

verses.zh: 他又对他们讲个比喻说：'天国好像面酵，有妇人拿来，藏在三斗面里，直等全团都发起来。'
verses.en: He told them still another parable: 'The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and mixed into about sixty pounds of flour until it worked all through the dough.'

verses.zh: 这都是耶稣用比喻对众人说的话；若不用比喻，就不对他们说什么。
verses.en: Jesus spoke all these things to the crowd in parables; he did not say anything to them without using a parable.

verses.zh: 这是要应验先知的话，说：我要开口用比喻，把创世以来所隐藏的事发明出来。
verses.en: So was fulfilled what was spoken through the prophet: 'I will open my mouth in parables, I will utter things hidden since the creation of the world.'

verses.zh: 当下，耶稣离开众人，进了房子。他的门徒进前来，说：'请把田间稗子的比喻讲给我们听。'
verses.en: Then he left the crowd and went into the house. His disciples came to him and said, 'Explain to us the parable of the weeds in the field.'

verses.zh: 他回答说：'那撒好种的就是人子；
verses.en: He answered, 'The one who sowed the good seed is the Son of Man.

verses.zh: 田地就是世界；好种就是天国之子；稗子就是那恶者之子；
verses.en: The field is the world, and the good seed stands for the people of the kingdom. The weeds are the people of the evil one,

verses.zh: 撒稗子的仙敌就是魔鬼；收割的时候就是世界的末了；收割的人就是天使。
verses.en: and the enemy who sows them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the harvesters are angels.

verses.zh: 将稗子薨出来用火焚烧，世界的末了也要如此。
verses.en: As the weeds are pulled up and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of the age.

verses.zh: 人子要差遣使者，把一切叫人跌倒的和作恶的，从他国里挑出来，
verses.en: The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will weed out of his kingdom everything that causes sin and all who do evil.

verses.zh: 丢在火炉里；在那里必要哀哭切齿了。
verses.en: They will throw them into the blazing furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

verses.zh: 那时，义人在他们父的国里，要发出光来，像太阳一样。有耳可听的，就应当听！
verses.en: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Whoever has ears, let them hear.

verses.zh: 天国好像宝贝藏在地里，人遇见了就把它藏起来，欢欢喜喜地去变卖一切所有的，买这块地。
verses.en: The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field. When a man found it, he hid it again, and then in his joy went and sold all he had and bought that field.

verses.zh: 天国又好像买卖人寻找好珠子，
verses.en: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant looking for fine pearls.

verses.zh: 遇见一颗重价的珠子，就去变卖他一切所有的，买了这颗珠子。
verses.en: When he found one of great value, he went away and sold everything he had and bought it.

verses.zh: 天国又好像网撞下在海里，聚拢各样水族，
verses.en: Once again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was let down into the lake and caught all kinds of fish.

verses.zh: 网既满了，人就拉上岸来，坐下，捡好的收在器具里，将不好的丢弃了。
verses.en: When it was full, the fishermen pulled it up on the shore. Then they sat down and collected the good fish in baskets, but threw the bad away.

verses.zh: 世界的末了也要这样。天使要出来，从义人中把恶人分别出来，
verses.en: This is how it will be at the end of the age. The angels will come and separate the wicked from the righteous

verses.zh: 丢在火炉里；在那里必要哀哭切齿了。'
verses.en: and throw them into the blazing furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'这一切的话你们都明白了吗？'他们说：'主啊，我们明白了。'
verses.en: 'Have you understood all these things?' Jesus asked. 'Yes,' they replied.

verses.zh: 他说：'凡文士受教作天国的门徒，就像一个家主从他库里拿出新旧的东西来。'
verses.en: He said to them, 'Therefore every teacher of the law who has become a disciple in the kingdom of heaven is like the owner of a house who brings out of his storeroom new treasures as well as old.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说完了这些比喻，就离开那里，
verses.en: When Jesus had finished these parables, he moved on from there.

verses.zh: 来到自己的家乡，在会堂里教训人，甚至他们都希奇，说：'这人从哪里有这等智慧和异能呢？
verses.en: Coming to his hometown, he began teaching the people in their synagogue, and they were amazed. 'Where did this man get this wisdom and these miraculous powers?' they asked.

verses.zh: 这不是木匠的儿子吗？他母亲不是叫马利亚吗？他弟兄们不是叫雅各、约西（有古卷作约瑟）、西门、犹大吗？
verses.en: Isn't this the carpenter's son? Isn't his mother's name Mary, and aren't his brothers James, Joseph, Simon and Judas?

verses.zh: 他妹妹们不是都在我们这里吗？这人从哪里有这一切呢？'
verses.en: Aren't all his sisters with us? Where then did this man get all these things?'

verses.zh: 他们就厨弃他（厨弃原文作跌倒）。耶稣对他们说：'大凡先知，除了本地本家之外，没有不被人尊敬的。'
verses.en: And they took offense at him. But Jesus said to them, 'A prophet is not without honor except in his own town and in his own home.'

verses.zh: 耶稣因为他们不信，就在那里不多行异能了。
verses.en: And he did not do many miracles there because of their lack of faith.

verses.zh: 那时，分封的王希律听见耶稣的名声，
verses.en: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the reports about Jesus,

verses.zh: 就对臣仆说：'这是施洗的约翰从死里复活，所以这些异能从他里面发出来。'
verses.en: and he said to his attendants, 'This is John the Baptist; he has risen from the dead! That is why miraculous powers are at work in him.'

verses.zh: 起先，希律为他兄弟腿力的妻子希罗底的缘故，把约翰抓住，锁在监里。
verses.en: Now Herod had arrested John and bound him and put him in prison because of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife,

verses.zh: 因为约翰曾对他说：'你娶这妇人是不合理的。'
verses.en: for John had been saying to him: 'It is not lawful for you to have her.'

verses.zh: 希律就想要杀他，只是怕百姓，因为他们以约翰为先知。
verses.en: Herod wanted to kill John, but he was afraid of the people, because they considered John a prophet.

verses.zh: 到了希律的生日，希罗底的女儿在众人面前跳舞，使希律欢喜。
verses.en: On Herod's birthday the daughter of Herodias danced for the guests and pleased Herod so much

verses.zh: 希律就起誓，应许随她所求的给她。
verses.en: that he promised with an oath to give her whatever she asked.

verses.zh: 女儿被母亲指使，就说：'请把施洗约翰的头放在盘子里，拿来给我。'
verses.en: Prompted by her mother, she said, 'Give me here on a platter the head of John the Baptist.'

verses.zh: 王就忧愁，但因他所起的誓，又因同席的人，就吩咐给她；
verses.en: The king was distressed, but because of his oaths and his dinner guests, he ordered that her request be granted

verses.zh: 于是打发人去，在监里斩了约翰，
verses.en: and had John beheaded in the prison.

verses.zh: 把头放在盘子里，拿来给了女子；女子拿去给了母亲。
verses.en: His head was brought in on a platter and given to the girl, who carried it to her mother.

verses.zh: 约翰的门徒来，把尸首领去埋葬了，就去告诉耶稣。
verses.en: John's disciples came and took his body and buried it. Then they went and told Jesus.

verses.zh: 耶稣听见了，就上船从那里独自退到野地里去。众人听见，就从各城里步行跟随他。
verses.en: When Jesus heard what had happened, he withdrew by boat privately to a solitary place. Hearing of this, the crowds followed him on foot from the towns.

verses.zh: 耶稣出来，见有许多的人，就怜悯他们，治好了他们的病人。
verses.en: When Jesus landed and saw a large crowd, he had compassion on them and healed their sick.

verses.zh: 天将晚的时候，门徒进前来，说：'这是野地，时候已经过了，请叫众人散开，他们好往村子里去买吃的。'
verses.en: As evening approached, the disciples came to him and said, 'This is a remote place, and it's already getting late. Send the crowds away, so they can go to the villages and buy themselves some food.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'不用他们去，你们给他们吃吧！'
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'They do not need to go away. You give them something to eat.'

verses.zh: 门徒说：'我们这里只有五个饼，两条鱼。'
verses.en: 'We have here only five loaves of bread and two fish,' they answered.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'拿过来给我。'
verses.en: 'Bring them here to me,' he said.

verses.zh: 于是吩咐众人坐在草地上，就拿着这五个饼、两条鱼，望着天祝谢，掉开饼，递给门徒，门徒又递给众人。
verses.en: And he directed the people to sit down on the grass. Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves. Then he gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the people.

verses.zh: 他们都吃，并且吃饱了，把剩下的碎屑收拾起来，装满了十二个篮子。
verses.en: They all ate and were satisfied, and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.

verses.zh: 吃的人，除了妇女孩子，约有五千。
verses.en: The number of those who ate was about five thousand men, besides women and children.

verses.zh: 耶稣随即催门徒上船，先渡到那边去，等他叫众人散开。
verses.en: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to the other side, while he dismissed the crowd.

verses.zh: 散了众人以后，他就独自上山去祷告。到了晚上，只有他一人在那里。
verses.en: After he had dismissed them, he went up on a mountainside by himself to pray. Later that night, he was there alone,

verses.zh: 那时船在海中，因风不顺，被波浪摇撑。
verses.en: and the boat was already a considerable distance from land, buffeted by the waves because the wind was against it.

verses.zh: 夜里四更天，耶稣在海面上走，往门徒那里去。
verses.en: Shortly before dawn Jesus went out to them, walking on the lake.

verses.zh: 门徒看见他在海面上走，就惊慌了，说：'是个鬼怪！'便害怕大叫。
verses.en: When the disciples saw him walking on the lake, they were terrified. 'It's a ghost,' they said, and cried out in fear.

verses.zh: 耶稣连忙对他们说：'你们放心，是我，不要怕！'
verses.en: But Jesus immediately said to them: 'Take courage! It is I. Don't be afraid.'

verses.zh: 彼得说：'主，如果是你，请叫我从水面上走到你那里去。'
verses.en: 'Lord, if it's you,' Peter replied, 'tell me to come to you on the water.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你来吧！'彼得就从船上下去，在水面上走，要到耶稣那里去；
verses.en: 'Come,' he said. Then Peter got down out of the boat, walked on the water and came toward Jesus.

verses.zh: 只因见风甚大，就害怕，将要沉下去，便大声喊着说：'主啊，救我！'
verses.en: But when he saw the wind, he was afraid and, beginning to sink, cried out, 'Lord, save me!'

verses.zh: 耶稣赶紧伸手拉住他，说：'你这小信的人哪，为什么疑惑呢？'
verses.en: Immediately Jesus reached out his hand and caught him. 'You of little faith,' he said, 'why did you doubt?'

verses.zh: 他们上了船，风就停了。
verses.en: And when they climbed into the boat, the wind died down.

verses.zh: 在船上的人都拜他，说：'你真是神的儿子了。'
verses.en: Then those who were in the boat worshiped him, saying, 'Truly you are the Son of God.'

verses.zh: 他们过了海，来到革尼撒勒地方。
verses.en: When they had crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret.

verses.zh: 那里的人一认出是耶稣，就打发人到周围地方去，把所有的病人带到他那里，
verses.en: And when the men of that place recognized Jesus, they sent word to all the surrounding country. People brought all their sick to him

verses.zh: 只求耶稣准他们摸他的衣裳繐子；摸着的人就都好了。
verses.en: and begged him to let the sick just touch the edge of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.

verses.zh: 那时，有法利赛人和文士从耶路撒冷来见耶稣，说：
verses.en: Then some Pharisees and teachers of the law came to Jesus from Jerusalem and asked,

verses.zh: '你的门徒为什么犯古人的遗传呢？因为吃饭的时候，他们不洗手。'
verses.en: 'Why do your disciples break the tradition of the elders? They don't wash their hands before they eat!'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'你们为什么因着你们的遗传犯神的诫命呢？
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'And why do you break the command of God for the sake of your tradition?

verses.zh: 神说：当孝敬父母；又说：咒骂父母的，必治死他。
verses.en: For God said, 'Honor your father and mother' and 'Anyone who curses their father or mother is to be put to death.'

verses.zh: 你们倒说：无论何人对父母说：我所当奉给你的已经作了供献，
verses.en: But you say that if anyone declares that what might have been used to help their father or mother is 'devoted to God,'

verses.zh: 他就可以不孝敬父母。这就是你们藉着遗传，废了神的诫命。
verses.en: they are not to 'honor their father or mother' with it. Thus you nullify the word of God for the sake of your tradition.

verses.zh: 假冒为善的人哪！以赛亚指着你们说的预言是不错的。他说：
verses.en: You hypocrites! Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you:

verses.zh: 这百姓用嘴唇尊敬我，心却远离我；
verses.en: 'These people honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me.

verses.zh: 他们将人的道理当作道理教导人，所以拜我也是徒然。'
verses.en: They worship me in vain; their teachings are merely human rules.'

verses.zh: 耶稣就叫众人来，对他们说：'你们要听，也要明白。
verses.en: Jesus called the crowd to him and said, 'Listen and understand.

verses.zh: 入口的不能污秽人，出口的乃能污秽人。'
verses.en: What goes into someone's mouth does not defile them, but what comes out of their mouth, that is what defiles them.'

verses.zh: 当时，门徒进前来对他说：'法利赛人听见这话，不服（原文作跌倒），你知道吗？'
verses.en: Then the disciples came to him and asked, 'Do you know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this?'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'凡栽种的物，若不是我天父栽种的，必要连根拔出来。
verses.en: He replied, 'Every plant that my heavenly Father has not planted will be pulled up by the roots.

verses.zh: 任凭他们吧！他们是瞎眼领路的；若是瞎子领瞎子，两个人都要掉在坑里。'
verses.en: Leave them; they are blind guides. If the blind lead the blind, both will fall into a pit.'

verses.zh: 彼得对耶稣说：'请将这比喻讲给我们听。'
verses.en: Peter said, 'Explain the parable to us.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们到如今还是不明白吗？
verses.en: 'Are you still so dull?' Jesus asked them.

verses.zh: 岂不知凡入口的，是运到腹里，又落在茅厕里吗？
verses.en: Don't you see that whatever enters the mouth goes into the stomach and then out of the body?

verses.zh: 惟独出口的，是从心里发出来的，这才污秽人。
verses.en: But the things that come out of a person's mouth come from the heart, and these defile them.

verses.zh: 因为从心里发出来的，有恶念、凶杀、奸淫、苟合、偷盗、假见证、谤讟。
verses.en: For out of the heart come evil thoughts—murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false testimony, slander.

verses.zh: 这都是污秽人的；至于不洗手吃饭，那却不污秽人。'
verses.en: These are what defile a person; but eating with unwashed hands does not defile them.'

verses.zh: 耶稣离开那里，退到推罗、西顿的境内去。
verses.en: Leaving that place, Jesus withdrew to the region of Tyre and Sidon.

verses.zh: 有一个迦南妇人从那地方出来，向耶稣喊着说：'主啊，大卫的子孙，可怜悯我！我女儿被鬼附得甚苦。'
verses.en: A Canaanite woman from that vicinity came to him, crying out, 'Lord, Son of David, have mercy on me! My daughter is demon-possessed and suffering terribly.'

verses.zh: 耶稣却一言不答。门徒进前来，求他说：'这妇人在我们后头喊叫，请打发她走吧！'
verses.en: Jesus did not answer a word. So his disciples came to him and urged him, 'Send her away, for she keeps crying out after us.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'我奉差遣不过是到以色列家迷失的羊那里去。'
verses.en: He answered, 'I was sent only to the lost sheep of Israel.'

verses.zh: 那妇人来拜他，说：'主啊，帮助我！'
verses.en: The woman came and knelt before him. 'Lord, help me!' she said.

verses.zh: 他回答说：'不好拿儿女的饼丢给狗吃。'
verses.en: He replied, 'It is not right to take the children's bread and toss it to the dogs.'

verses.zh: 妇人说：'主啊，不错；但是狗也吃主人桌子上掉下来的碎渣儿。'
verses.en: 'Yes it is, Lord,' she said. 'Even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their master's table.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'妇人，你的信心是大的！照你所要的，给你成全了。'从那时候，她女儿就好了。
verses.en: Then Jesus said to her, 'Woman, you have great faith! Your request is granted.' And her daughter was healed at that moment.

verses.zh: 耶稣离开那里，来到靠近加利利的海边，就上山坐下。
verses.en: Jesus left there and went along the Sea of Galilee. Then he went up on a mountainside and sat down.

verses.zh: 有许多人到他那里，带着瘸子、瞎子、哑巴、有残疾的，和好些别的病人，都放在他脚前；他就治好了他们。
verses.en: Great crowds came to him, bringing the lame, the blind, the crippled, the mute and many others, and laid them at his feet; and he healed them.

verses.zh: 甚至众人都希奇；因为看见哑巴说话，残疾的痊愈，瘸子行走，瞎子看见，他们就归荣耀给以色列的神。
verses.en: The people were amazed when they saw the mute speaking, the crippled made well, the lame walking and the blind seeing. And they praised the God of Israel.

verses.zh: 耶稣叫门徒来，说：'我怜悯这众人；因为他们同我在这里已经三天，也没有吃的了。我不愿意叫他们饿着回去，恐怕在路上困乏。'
verses.en: Jesus called his disciples to him and said, 'I have compassion for these people; they have already been with me three days and have nothing to eat. I do not want to send them away hungry, or they may collapse on the way.'

verses.zh: 门徒说：'我们在这野地，哪里有这么多的饼叫这许多的人吃饱呢？'
verses.en: His disciples answered, 'Where could we get enough bread in this remote place to feed such a crowd?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们有多少饼？'他们说：'七个，还有几条小鱼。'
verses.en: 'How many loaves do you have?' Jesus asked. 'Seven,' they replied, 'and a few small fish.'

verses.zh: 他就吩咐众人坐在地上，
verses.en: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground.

verses.zh: 拿着这七个饼和几条鱼，祝谢了，掂开，递给门徒；门徒又递给众人。
verses.en: Then he took the seven loaves and the fish, and when he had given thanks, he broke them and gave them to the disciples, and they in turn to the people.

verses.zh: 众人都吃，并且吃饱了。收拾剩下的碎屑，装满了七个筐子。
verses.en: They all ate and were satisfied. Afterward the disciples picked up seven basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.

verses.zh: 吃的人，除了妇女孩子，共有四千。
verses.en: The number of those who ate was four thousand men, besides women and children.

verses.zh: 耶稣叫众人散去，就上船，来到马大拉的境界。
verses.en: After Jesus had sent the crowd away, he got into the boat and went to the vicinity of Magadan.

verses.zh: 过了六天，耶稣带着彼得、雅各和雅各的兄弟约翰，暗暗地上了高山，
verses.en: After six days Jesus took with him Peter, James and John the brother of James, and led them up a high mountain by themselves.

verses.zh: 就在他们面前变了形像，脸面明亮像日头，衣裳洁白像光。
verses.en: There he was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and his clothes became as white as the light.

verses.zh: 忽然，有摩西、以利亚向他们显现，同耶稣说话。
verses.en: Just then there appeared before them Moses and Elijah, talking with Jesus.

verses.zh: 彼得对耶稣说：'主啊，我们在这里真好！你若愿意，我就在这里搭三座棚，一座为你，一座为摩西，一座为以利亚。'
verses.en: Peter said to Jesus, 'Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you wish, I will put up three shelters—one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah.'

verses.zh: 说话之间，忽然有一朵光明的云彩遮盖他们，且有声音从云彩里出来，说：'这是我的爱子，我所喜悦的。你们要听他！'
verses.en: While he was still speaking, a bright cloud covered them, and a voice from the cloud said, 'This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased. Listen to him!'

verses.zh: 门徒听见，就俯伏在地，极其害怕。
verses.en: When the disciples heard this, they fell facedown to the ground, terrified.

verses.zh: 耶稣进前来，摸他们，说：'起来，不要怕！'
verses.en: But Jesus came and touched them. 'Get up,' he said. 'Don't be afraid.'

verses.zh: 他们举目不见一人，只见耶稣在那里。
verses.en: When they looked up, they saw no one except Jesus.

verses.zh: 下山的时候，耶稣嘱咐他们说：'人子还没有从死里复活，你们不要将所看见的告诉人。'
verses.en: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus instructed them, 'Don't tell anyone what you have seen, until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead.'

verses.zh: 门徒问耶稣说：'文士为什么说以利亚必须先来？'
verses.en: The disciples asked him, 'Why then do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must come first?'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'以利亚固然先来，并要复兴万事；
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'To be sure, Elijah comes and will restore all things.

verses.zh: 只是我告诉你们，以利亚已经来了，人却不认识他，竟任意待他。人子也将要这样受他们的害。'
verses.en: But I tell you, Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but have done to him everything they wished. In the same way the Son of Man is going to suffer at their hands.'

verses.zh: 门徒这才明白耶稣所说的是指着施洗的约翰。
verses.en: Then the disciples understood that he was talking to them about John the Baptist.

verses.zh: 耶稣和门徒到了众人那里，有一个人来见耶稣，跪下，说：
verses.en: When they came to the crowd, a man approached Jesus and knelt before him.

verses.zh: '主啊，怜悯我的儿子！他害癫痫的病很苦，屡次跌在火里，屡次跌在水里。
verses.en: 'Lord, have mercy on my son,' he said. 'He has seizures and is suffering greatly. He often falls into the fire or into the water.

verses.zh: 我带他到你门徒那里，他们却不能医治他。'
verses.en: I brought him to your disciples, but they could not heal him.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'嗳，这又不信又悖谬的世代啊，我在你们这里要到几时呢？我忍耐你们要到几时呢？把他带到我这里来吧！'
verses.en: 'You unbelieving and perverse generation,' Jesus replied, 'how long shall I stay with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring the boy here to me.'

verses.zh: 耶稣就斥责那鬼，鬼就出来；从此孩子就痊愈了。
verses.en: Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of the boy, and he was healed at that moment.

verses.zh: 门徒暗暗地到耶稣跟前，说：'我们为什么不能赶出那鬼呢？'
verses.en: Then the disciples came to Jesus in private and asked, 'Why couldn't we drive it out?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'是因你们的信心小。我实在告诉你们：你们若有信心像一粒芥菜种，就是对这座山说：你从这边挪到那边！它也必挪去；并且你们没有一件不能做的事了。'
verses.en: He replied, 'Because you have so little faith. Truly I tell you, if you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, 'Move from here to there,' and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you.'

verses.zh: 至于这一类的鬼，若不祷告、禁食，他就不出来（或作：不能赶他出来）。'
verses.en: But this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting.

verses.zh: 他们还住在加利利的时候，耶稣对门徒说：'人子将要被交在人手里。
verses.en: When they came together in Galilee, he said to them, 'The Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men.

verses.zh: 他们要杀害他，第三日他要复活。'门徒就大大地忧愁。
verses.en: They will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised to life.' And the disciples were filled with grief.

verses.zh: 到了迦百农，有收丁税的人来见彼得，说：'你们的先生不纳丁税（丁税约有半块钱）吗？'
verses.en: After Jesus and his disciples arrived in Capernaum, the collectors of the two-drachma temple tax came to Peter and asked, 'Doesn't your teacher pay the temple tax?'

verses.zh: 彼得说：'纳。'他进了屋子，耶稣先向他说：'西门，你的意思如何？世上的君王向谁征收关税、丁税？是向自己的儿子呢？是向外人呢？'
verses.en: 'Yes, he does,' he replied. When Peter came into the house, Jesus was the first to speak. 'What do you think, Simon?' he asked. 'From whom do the kings of the earth collect duty and taxes—from their own children or from others?'

verses.zh: 彼得说：'是向外人。'耶稣说：'既然如此，儿子就可以免税了。
verses.en: 'From others,' Peter answered. 'Then the children are exempt,' Jesus said to him.

verses.zh: 但恐怕触犯（触犯：原文是绊倒）他们，你且往海边去钓鱼，把先钓上来的鱼拿起来，开了它的口，必得一块钱，可以拿去给他们，作你我的税银。'
verses.en: But so that we may not cause offense, go to the lake and throw out your line. Take the first fish you catch; open its mouth and you will find a four-drachma coin. Take it and give it to them for my tax and yours.'

verses.zh: 因为天国好像家主清早去雇人进他的葡萄园作工，
verses.en: For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.

verses.zh: 和工人讲定一天一钱银子，就打发他们进葡萄园去。
verses.en: He agreed to pay them a denarius for the day and sent them into his vineyard.

verses.zh: 约在巳初出去，看见市上还有闲站的人，
verses.en: About nine in the morning he went out and saw others standing in the marketplace doing nothing.

verses.zh: 就对他们说：'你们也进葡萄园去，所当给的，我必给你们。'他们也进去了。
verses.en: He told them, 'You also go and work in my vineyard, and I will pay you whatever is right.'

verses.zh: 约在午正和申初又出去，也是这样行。
verses.en: So they went. He went out again about noon and about three in the afternoon and did the same thing.

verses.zh: 约在酉初出去，看见还有人站在那里，就问他们说：'你们为什么整天在这里闲站呢？'
verses.en: About five in the afternoon he went out and found still others standing around. He asked them, 'Why have you been standing here all day long doing nothing?'

verses.zh: 他们说：'因为没有人雇我们。'他说：'你们也进葡萄园去。'
verses.en: 'Because no one has hired us,' they answered. He said to them, 'You also go and work in my vineyard.'

verses.zh: 到了晚上，园主对管事的说：'叫工人都来，给他们工钱，从后来的起，到先来的为止。'
verses.en: When evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, 'Call the workers and pay them their wages, beginning with the last ones hired and going on to the first.'

verses.zh: 约在酉初雇的人来了，各人得了一钱银子。
verses.en: The workers who were hired about five in the afternoon came and each received a denarius.

verses.zh: 及至那先雇的来了，他们以为必要多得；谁知也是各得一钱。
verses.en: So when those came who were hired first, they expected to receive more. But each one of them also received a denarius.

verses.zh: 他们得了，就埋怨家主说：
verses.en: When they received it, they began to grumble against the landowner.

verses.zh: '我们整天劳苦受热，那后来的只做了一小时，你竟叫他们和我们一样吗？'
verses.en: 'These who were hired last worked only one hour,' they said, 'and you have made them equal to us who have borne the burden of the work and the heat of the day.'

verses.zh: 家主回答其中的一人说：'朋友，我不亏负你，你与我讲定的不是一钱银子吗？
verses.en: But he answered one of them, 'I am not being unfair to you, friend. Didn't you agree to work for a denarius?

verses.zh: 拿你的走吧！我给那后来的和给你一样，这是我愿意的。
verses.en: Take your pay and go. I want to give the one who was hired last the same as I gave you.

verses.zh: 我的东西难道不可随我的意思用吗？因为我作好人，你就红了眼吗？'
verses.en: Don't I have the right to do what I want with my own money? Or are you envious because I am generous?'

verses.zh: 这样，那在后的，将要在前；在前的，将要在后了。（有古卷加：因为被召的人多，选上的人少。）
verses.en: So the last will be first, and the first will be last.

verses.zh: 耶稣上耶路撒冷去的时候，在路上把十二个门徒带到一边，对他们说：
verses.en: Now Jesus was going up to Jerusalem. On the way, he took the Twelve aside and said to them,

verses.zh: '看哪，我们上耶路撒冷去，人子要被交给祭司长和文士。他们要定他死罪，
verses.en: 'We are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered over to the chief priests and the teachers of the law. They will condemn him to death

verses.zh: 又交给外邦人，将他戏弄，鞭打，钉在十字架上；第三日他要复活。'
verses.en: and will hand him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and flogged and crucified. On the third day he will be raised to life!'

verses.zh: 那时，西庇太儿子的母亲同她两个儿子上前来拜耶稣，求他一件事。
verses.en: Then the mother of Zebedee's sons came to Jesus with her sons and, kneeling down, asked a favor of him.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你要什么呢？'她说：'愿你叫我这两个儿子在你国里，一个坐在你右边，一个坐在你左边。'
verses.en: 'What is it you want?' he asked. She said, 'Grant that one of these two sons of mine may sit at your right and the other at your left in your kingdom.'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'你们不知道所求的是什么；我将要喝的杯，你们能喝吗？'他们说：'我们能。'
verses.en: 'You don't know what you are asking,' Jesus said to them. 'Can you drink the cup I am going to drink?' 'We can,' they answered.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'我所喝的杯，你们必要喝；只是坐在我的左右，不是我可以赐的，乃是我父为谁预备的，就赐给谁。'
verses.en: Jesus said to them, 'You will indeed drink from my cup, but to sit at my right or left is not for me to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared by my Father.'

verses.zh: 那十个门徒听见，就恼怒他们弟兄二人。
verses.en: When the ten heard about this, they were indignant with the two brothers.

verses.zh: 耶稣叫了他们来，说：'你们知道外邦人有君王为主治理他们，有大臣操权管束他们。
verses.en: Jesus called them together and said, 'You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their high officials exercise authority over them.

verses.zh: 只是在你们中间不可这样。你们中间谁愿为大，就必作你们的用人；
verses.en: Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,

verses.zh: 谁愿为首，就必作你们的仆人。
verses.en: and whoever wants to be first must be your slave—

verses.zh: 正如人子来，不是要受人的服事，乃是要服事人，并且要舍命作多人的赎价。'
verses.en: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.'

verses.zh: 他们出耶利哥的时候，有极多的人跟随他。
verses.en: As Jesus and his disciples were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed him.

verses.zh: 有两个瞎子坐在路旁，听说是耶稣经过，就喊着说：'主啊，大卫的子孙，可怜我们吧！'
verses.en: Two blind men were sitting by the roadside, and when they heard that Jesus was going by, they shouted, 'Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!'

verses.zh: 众人责备他们，不许他们作声；他们却越发喊着说：'主啊，大卫的子孙，可怜我们吧！'
verses.en: The crowd rebuked them and told them to be quiet, but they shouted all the louder, 'Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!'

verses.zh: 耶稣就站住，叫他们来，说：'要我为你们做什么？'
verses.en: Jesus stopped and called them. 'What do you want me to do for you?' he asked.

verses.zh: 他们说：'主啊，要我们的眼睛能看见！'
verses.en: 'Lord,' they answered, 'we want our sight.'

verses.zh: 耶稣就动了慈心，把他们的眼睛一摸，他们立刻看见，就跟从了耶稣。
verses.en: Jesus had compassion on them and touched their eyes. Immediately they received their sight and followed him.

verses.zh: 耶稣和门徒将近耶路撒冷，到了伯法其，在橄榄山那里。
verses.en: As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples,

verses.zh: 耶稣就打发两个门徒，对他们说：'你们往对面村子里去，必看见一匹驴拴在那里，还有驴驹同在一处；你们解开，牵到我这里来。
verses.en: saying to them, 'Go to the village ahead of you, and at once you will find a donkey tied there, with her colt by her. Untie them and bring them to me.

verses.zh: 若有人对你们说什么，你们就说：主要用他。'那人必立时让你们牵来。
verses.en: If anyone says anything to you, say that the Lord needs them, and he will send them right away.'

verses.zh: 这事成就是要应验先知的话，说：
verses.en: This took place to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet:

verses.zh: '要对锡安的女儿说：看哪，你的王来到你这里，是温柔的，又骑着驴，就是骑着驴驹子。'
verses.en: 'Say to Daughter Zion, See, your king comes to you, gentle and riding on a donkey, and on a colt, the foal of a donkey.'

verses.zh: 门徒就照耶稣所吩咐的去行，
verses.en: The disciples went and did as Jesus had instructed them.

verses.zh: 牵了驴和驴驹来，把自己的衣服搭在上面，耶稣就骑上。
verses.en: They brought the donkey and the colt and placed their cloaks on them for Jesus to sit on.

verses.zh: 众人多半把衣服铺在路上；还有人砍下树枝来铺在路上。
verses.en: A very large crowd spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.

verses.zh: 前行后随的众人喊着说：'和散那（原有求救的意思，在此是称颂的话）归于大卫的子孙！奉主名来的是应当称颂的！高高在上和散那！'
verses.en: The crowds that went ahead of him and those that followed shouted, 'Hosanna to the Son of David!' 'Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!' 'Hosanna in the highest heaven!'

verses.zh: 耶稣既进了耶路撒冷，合城都惊动了，说：'这是谁？'
verses.en: When Jesus entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred and asked, 'Who is this?'

verses.zh: 众人说：'这是加利利拿撒勒的先知耶稣。'
verses.en: The crowds answered, 'This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee.'

verses.zh: 耶稣进了神的殿，赶出殿里一切做买卖的人，推倒兑换银钱之人的桌子，和卖鸽子之人的凳子，
verses.en: Jesus entered the temple courts and drove out all who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves.

verses.zh: 对他们说：'经上记着说：我的殿必称为祷告的殿，你们倒使它成为贼窝了。'
verses.en: 'It is written,' he said to them, 'My house will be called a house of prayer, but you are making it a den of robbers.'

verses.zh: 在殿里有瞎子、瘸子到耶稣跟前，他就治好了他们。
verses.en: The blind and the lame came to him at the temple, and he healed them.

verses.zh: 祭司长和文士看见耶稣所行的奇事，又见小孩子在殿里喊着说：'和散那归于大卫的子孙！'就甚恼怒，
verses.en: But when the chief priests and the teachers of the law saw the wonderful things he did and the children shouting in the temple courts, 'Hosanna to the Son of David,' they were indignant.

verses.zh: 对他说：'这些人所说的，你听见了吗？'耶稣说：'是的。经上说婴孩和吃奶的口中完备了赞美的话，你们没有念过吗？'
verses.en: 'Do you hear what these children are saying?' they asked him. 'Yes,' replied Jesus, 'have you never read, From the lips of children and infants you, Lord, have called forth your praise'?

verses.zh: 于是离开他们，出城到伯大尼去，在那里住宿。
verses.en: And he left them and went out of the city to Bethany, where he spent the night.

verses.zh: 早晨回城的时候，他饿了，
verses.en: Early in the morning, as Jesus was on his way back to the city, he was hungry.

verses.zh: 看见路旁有一棵无花果树，就走到跟前，在树上找不着什么，不过有叶子，就对树说：'从今以后，你永不结果子。'那无花果树就立刻枯干了。
verses.en: Seeing a fig tree by the road, he went up to it but found nothing on it except leaves. Then he said to it, 'May you never bear fruit again!' Immediately the tree withered.

verses.zh: 门徒看见了，便希奇说：'无花果树怎么立刻枯干了呢？'
verses.en: When the disciples saw this, they were amazed. 'How did the fig tree wither so quickly?' they asked.

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'我实在告诉你们，你们若有信心，不疑惑，不但能行无花果树上所行的事，就是对这座山说：你挪开此地，投在海里！也必成就。
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'Truly I tell you, if you have faith and do not doubt, not only can you do what was done to the fig tree, but also you can say to this mountain, Go, throw yourself into the sea, and it will be done.

verses.zh: 你们祷告，无论求什么，只要信，就必得着。'
verses.en: If you believe, you will receive whatever you ask for in prayer.'

verses.zh: 耶稣进了殿，正教训人的时候，祭司长和民间的长老来问他说：'你仗着什么权柄做这些事？给你这权柄的是谁呢？'
verses.en: Jesus entered the temple courts, and, while he was teaching, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him. 'By what authority are you doing these things?' they asked. 'And who gave you this authority?'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'我也要问你们一句话，你们若告诉我，我就告诉你们我仗着什么权柄做这些事。
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'I will also ask you one question. If you answer me, I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

verses.zh: 约翰的洗礼是从哪里来的？是从天上来的？是从人间来的呢？'他们彼此商议说：'我们若说从天上来，他必对我们说：这样，你们为什么不信他呢？
verses.en: John's baptism—where did it come from? Was it from heaven, or of human origin?' They discussed it among themselves and said, 'If we say, From heaven, he will ask, Then why didn't you believe him?

verses.zh: 若说从人间来，我们又怕百姓，因为他们都以约翰为先知。'
verses.en: But if we say, Of human origin—we are afraid of the people, for they all hold that John was a prophet.'

verses.zh: 于是回答耶稣说：'我们不知道。'耶稣说：'我也不告诉你们我仗着什么权柄做这些事。'
verses.en: So they answered Jesus, 'We don't know.' Then he said, 'Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

verses.zh: '一个人有两个儿子。他来对大儿子说：我儿，你今天到葡萄园里去做工。
verses.en: 'What do you think? There was a man who had two sons. He went to the first and said, Son, go and work today in the vineyard.

verses.zh: 他回答说：我不去，以后自己懊悔，就去了。
verses.en: 'I will not,' he answered, but later he changed his mind and went.

verses.zh: 又来对小儿子也是这样说。他回答说：父啊，我去，他却不去。
verses.en: Then the father went to the other son and said the same thing. He answered, 'I will, sir,' but he did not go.

verses.zh: 你们想，这两个儿子是谁遵行父命呢？'他们说：'大儿子。'耶稣说：'我实在告诉你们，税吏和娼妓倒比你们先进神的国。
verses.en: 'Which of the two did what his father wanted?' 'The first,' they answered. Jesus said to them, 'Truly I tell you, the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering the kingdom of God ahead of you.

verses.zh: 因为约翰遵着义路到你们这里来，你们却不信他；税吏和娼妓倒信他。你们看见了，后来还是不懊悔去信他。'
verses.en: For John came to you to show you the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes did. And even after you saw this, you did not repent and believe him.

verses.zh: '你们再听一个比喻：有个家主栽了一个葡萄园，周围圈上篱笆，里面挖了一个压酒池，盖了一座楼，租给园户，就往外国去了。
verses.en: 'Listen to another parable: There was a landowner who planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a winepress in it and built a watchtower. Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and moved to another place.

verses.zh: 收果子的时候近了，就打发仆人到园户那里去收果子。
verses.en: When the harvest time approached, he sent his servants to the tenants to collect his fruit.

verses.zh: 园户拿住仆人，打了一个，杀了一个，用石头打死一个。
verses.en: The tenants seized his servants; they beat one, killed another, and stoned a third.

verses.zh: 主人又打发别的仆人去，比先前更多；园户还是照样待他们。
verses.en: Then he sent other servants to them, more than the first time, and the tenants treated them the same way.

verses.zh: 后来打发他的儿子到他们那里去，意思说：他们必尊敬我的儿子。
verses.en: Last of all, he sent his son to them. 'They will respect my son,' he said.

verses.zh: 不料，园户看见他儿子，就彼此说：这是承受产业的。来吧，我们杀他，占他的产业！
verses.en: But when the tenants saw the son, they said to each other, 'This is the heir. Come, let's kill him and take his inheritance.'

verses.zh: 他们就拿住他，推出葡萄园外，杀了。
verses.en: So they took him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.

verses.zh: 园主来的时候要怎样处治这些园户呢？'
verses.en: 'Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those tenants?'

verses.zh: 他们说：'要下毒手除灭那些恶人，将葡萄园另租给那按着时候交果子的园户。'
verses.en: 'He will bring those wretches to a wretched end,' they replied, 'and he will rent the vineyard to other tenants, who will give him his share of the crop at harvest time.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'经上写着：匠人所弃的石头已作了房角的头块石头。这是主所做的，在我们眼中看为希奇。这经你们没有念过吗？
verses.en: Jesus said to them, 'Have you never read in the Scriptures: The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone; the Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes?

verses.zh: 所以我告诉你们，神的国必从你们夺去，赐给那能结果子的百姓。
verses.en: Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.

verses.zh: 谁掉在这石头上，必要跌碎；这石头掉在谁的身上，就要把谁砸得稀烂。'
verses.en: Anyone who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces; anyone on whom it falls will be crushed.'

verses.zh: 祭司长和法利赛人听见他的比喻，就看出他是指着他们说的。
verses.en: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard Jesus' parables, they knew he was talking about them.

verses.zh: 他们想要捉拿他，只是怕众人，因为众人以他为先知。
verses.en: They looked for a way to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowd because the people held that he was a prophet.

verses.zh: 那时，耶稣对众人和门徒讲论，
verses.en: Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples:

verses.zh: 说：'文士和法利赛人坐在摩西的位上，
verses.en: 'The teachers of the law and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat.

verses.zh: 凡他们所吸咐你们的，你们都要谨守遵行；但不要效法他们的行为；因为他们能说，不能行。
verses.en: So you must be careful to do everything they tell you. But do not do what they do, for they do not practice what they preach.

verses.zh: 他们把难担的重担捕起来，搭在人的肩上，但自己一个指头也不肯动。
verses.en: They tie up heavy, cumbersome loads and put them on other people's shoulders, but they themselves are not willing to lift a finger to move them.

verses.zh: 他们一切所做的事都是要叫人看见，所以将佩经做宽了，衣裳的繅子做长了；
verses.en: Everything they do is done for people to see: They make their phylacteries wide and the tassels on their garments long;

verses.zh: 喜爱筵席上的首位，会堂里的高位，
verses.en: they love the place of honor at banquets and the most important seats in the synagogues;

verses.zh: 又喜爱人在街市上问他安，称呼他拉比（拉比就是先生的意思）。
verses.en: they love to be greeted with respect in the marketplaces and to be called Rabbi by others.

verses.zh: 但你们不要受拉比的称呼，因为只有一位是你们的先生；你们都是弟兄。
verses.en: But you are not to be called Rabbi, for you have one Teacher, and you are all brothers.

verses.zh: 也不要称呼地上的人为父，因为只有一位是你们的父，就是在天上的父。
verses.en: And do not call anyone on earth father, for you have one Father, and he is in heaven.

verses.zh: 也不要受师尊的称呼，因为只有一位是你们的师尊，就是基督。
verses.en: Nor are you to be called instructors, for you have one Instructor, the Messiah.

verses.zh: 你们中间谁为大，谁就要作你们的用人。
verses.en: The greatest among you will be your servant.

verses.zh: 凡自高的，必降为卑；自卑的，必升为高。
verses.en: For those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.

verses.zh: '你们这假善的文士和法利赛人有祸了！因为你们正当人面前，把天国的门关了，自己不进去，正要进去的人，你们也不容他们进去。（有古卷在此有：
verses.en: Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You shut the door of the kingdom of heaven in people's faces. You yourselves do not enter, nor will you let those enter who are trying to.

verses.zh: 你们这假善的文士和法利赛人有祸了！因为你们侵吞寺妇的家产，假意做很长的祷告，所以要受更重的刑罚。）
verses.en: Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You devour widows' houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. Therefore you will be punished more severely.

verses.zh: 你们这假善的文士和法利赛人有祸了！因为你们走遍洋海陆地，勾引一个人入教，既入了教，却使他作地狱之子，比你们还加倍。
verses.en: Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You travel over land and sea to win a single convert, and when you have succeeded, you make them twice as much a child of hell as you are.

verses.zh: 你们这瀞眼领路的有祸了！你们说：凡指着殿起誓的，这算不得什么；只是指着殿中金子起誓的，他就该谨守。
verses.en: Woe to you, blind guides! You say, 'If anyone swears by the temple, it means nothing; but anyone who swears by the gold of the temple is bound by that oath.'

verses.zh: 你们这无知瀞眼的人哪！什么是大的？是金子呢？还是叫金子成圣的殿呢？
verses.en: You blind fools! Which is greater: the gold, or the temple that makes the gold sacred?

verses.zh: 你们又说：凡指着坛起誓的，这算不得什么；只是指着坛上礼物起誓的，他就该谨守。
verses.en: You also say, 'If anyone swears by the altar, it means nothing; but anyone who swears by the gift on the altar is bound by that oath.'

verses.zh: 你们这瀞眼的人哪！什么是大的？是礼物呢？还是叫礼物成圣的坛呢？
verses.en: You blind men! Which is greater: the gift, or the altar that makes the gift sacred?

verses.zh: 所以，指着坛起誓的，就是指着坛和坛上一切所有的起誓；
verses.en: Therefore, anyone who swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.

verses.zh: 指着殿起誓的，就是指着殿和那住在殿里的起誓；
verses.en: And anyone who swears by the temple swears by it and by the one who dwells in it.

verses.zh: 指着天起誓的，就是指着神的宝座和那坐在上面的起誓。
verses.en: And anyone who swears by heaven swears by God's throne and by the one who sits on it.

verses.zh: 你们这假善的文士和法利赛人有祸了！因为你们将薄荷、茎香、芹菜献上十分之一，只是忽略了律法上更重的事，就是公义、怜悯、信实。这更重的是你们当行的；那也是不可不行的。
verses.en: Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You give a tenth of your spices—mint, dill and cumin. But you have neglected the more important matters of the law—justice, mercy and faithfulness. You should have practiced the latter, without neglecting the former.

verses.zh: 你们这瀞眼领路的，蠵出蚓虫，吐下骆驼！
verses.en: You blind guides! You strain out a gnat but swallow a camel.

verses.zh: 你们这假善的文士和法利赛人有祸了！因为你们洗净杯盘的外面，里面却盛满了勒索和放荡。
verses.en: Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.

verses.zh: 你这瀞眼的法利赛人，先洗净杯盘的里面，好叫外面也干净了。
verses.en: Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and dish, and then the outside also will be clean.

verses.zh: 你们这假善的文士和法利赛人有祸了！因为你们好像粉饰的坟墓，外面好看，里面却装满了死人的骨头和一切的污秽。
verses.en: Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs, which look beautiful on the outside but on the inside are full of the bones of the dead and everything unclean.

verses.zh: 你们也是如此，在人前，外面显出公义来，里面却装满了假善和不法的事。
verses.en: In the same way, on the outside you appear to people as righteous but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.

verses.zh: 你们这假善的文士和法利赛人有祸了！因为你们建造先知的坟，修饰义人的墓，
verses.en: Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous.

verses.zh: 说：若是我们在我们祖宗的时候，必不和他们同流先知的血。
verses.en: And you say, 'If we had lived in the days of our ancestors, we would not have taken part with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.'

verses.zh: 这就是你们自己证明是杀害先知者的子孙了。
verses.en: So you testify against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.

verses.zh: 你们去充满你们祖宗的恶贯吧！
verses.en: Go ahead, then, and complete what your ancestors started!

verses.zh: 你们这些蛇类、毒蛇的种类啊，怎能逃脱地狱的刑罚呢？
verses.en: You snakes! You brood of vipers! How will you escape being condemned to hell?

verses.zh: 所以我差遣先知和智慧人并文士到你们这里来，有的你们要杀害，要钉十字架；有的你们要在会堂里鞭打，从这城追逐到那城，
verses.en: Therefore I am sending you prophets and sages and teachers. Some of them you will kill and crucify; others you will flog in your synagogues and pursue from town to town.

verses.zh: 叫世上所流义人的血都归到你们身上，从义人亚伯的血起，直到你们在殿和坛中间所杀的巴拉加的儿子撒迦亚的血为止。
verses.en: And so upon you will come all the righteous blood that has been shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berekiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，这一切的罪都要归到这世代了。
verses.en: Truly I tell you, all this will come on this generation.

verses.zh: 耶路撒冷啊，耶路撒冷啊，你常杀害先知，又用石头打死那奥遣到你这里来的人。我多次愿意聚集你的儿女，好像母鸡把小鸡聚集在翅膀底下，只是你们不愿意。
verses.en: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were not willing.

verses.zh: 看哪，你们的家成为荒场留给你们。
verses.en: Look, your house is left to you desolate.

verses.zh: 我告诉你们，从今以后，你们不得再见我，直等到你们说：奥主名来的是应当称颂的！'
verses.en: For I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, 'Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.'

verses.zh: 那时，天国好比十个童女拿着灯出去迎接新郎。
verses.en: At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.

verses.zh: 其中有五个是愚拙的，五个是聪明的。
verses.en: Five of them were foolish and five were wise.

verses.zh: 愚拙的拿着灯，却不预备油；
verses.en: The foolish ones took their lamps but did not take any oil with them.

verses.zh: 聪明的拿着灯，又预备油在器皿里。
verses.en: The wise ones, however, took oil in jars along with their lamps.

verses.zh: 新郎迟延的时候，她们都打盹，睡着了。
verses.en: The bridegroom was a long time in coming, and they all became drowsy and fell asleep.

verses.zh: 半夜有人喊着说：'新郎来了，你们出来迎接他！'
verses.en: At midnight the cry rang out: 'Here's the bridegroom! Come out to meet him!'

verses.zh: 那些童女就都起来收拾灯。
verses.en: Then all the virgins woke up and trimmed their lamps.

verses.zh: 愚拙的对聪明的说：'请分点油给我们，因为我们的灯要灭了。'
verses.en: The foolish ones said to the wise, 'Give us some of your oil; our lamps are going out.'

verses.zh: 聪明的回答说：'恐怕不够你我用的；不如你们自己到卖油的那里去买吧。'
verses.en: 'No,' they replied, 'there may not be enough for both us and you. Instead, go to those who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.'

verses.zh: 她们去买的时候，新郎到了，那预备好了的，同他进去坐席，门就关了。
verses.en: But while they were on their way to buy the oil, the bridegroom arrived. The virgins who were ready went in with him to the wedding banquet. And the door was shut.

verses.zh: 其余的童女随后也来了，说：'主啊，主啊，给我们开门！'
verses.en: Later the others also came. 'Lord, Lord,' they said, 'open the door for us!'

verses.zh: 他却回答说：'我实在告诉你们，我不认识你们。'
verses.en: But he replied, 'Truly I tell you, I don't know you.'

verses.zh: 所以，你们要警醒；因为那日子，那时辰，你们不知道。
verses.en: Therefore keep watch, because you do not know the day or the hour.

verses.zh: 天国又好比一个人要往外国去，就叫了仆人来，把他的家业交给他们。
verses.en: Again, it will be like a man going on a journey, who called his servants and entrusted his wealth to them.

verses.zh: 按着各人的才干给他们银子：一个给了五千，一个给了二千，一个给了一千，就往外国去了。
verses.en: To one he gave five bags of gold, to another two bags, and to another one bag, each according to his ability. Then he went on his journey.

verses.zh: 那领五千的随即拿去做买卖，另外赚了五千。
verses.en: The man who had received five bags of gold went at once and put his money to work and gained five bags more.

verses.zh: 那领二千的也照样另外赚了二千。
verses.en: So also, the one with two bags of gold gained two more.

verses.zh: 但那领一千的去掘开地，把主人的银子埋藏了。
verses.en: But the man who had received one bag went off, dug a hole in the ground and hid his master's money.

verses.zh: 过了许久，那些仆人的主人来了，和他们算账。
verses.en: After a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them.

verses.zh: 那领五千银子的又带着那另外的五千来，说：'主啊，你交给我五千银子。请看，我又赚了五千。'
verses.en: The man who had received five bags of gold brought the other five. 'Master,' he said, 'you entrusted me with five bags of gold. See, I have gained five more.'

verses.zh: 主人说：好！你这又良善又忠心的仆人，你在不多的事上有忠心，我要把许多事派你管理；可以进来享受你主人的快乐。
verses.en: His master replied, 'Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master's happiness!'

verses.zh: 那领二千的也来，说：'主啊，你交给我二千银子。请看，我又赚了二千。'
verses.en: The man with two bags of gold also came. 'Master,' he said, 'you entrusted me with two bags of gold; see, I have gained two more.'

verses.zh: 主人说：'好，你这又良善又忠心的仆人，你在不多的事上有忠心，我要把许多事派你管理；可以进来享受你主人的快乐。'
verses.en: His master replied, 'Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master's happiness!'

verses.zh: 那领一千的也来，说：'主啊，我知道你是忍心的人，没有种的地方要收割，没有散的地方要聚敛。
verses.en: Then the man who had received one bag of gold came. 'Master,' he said, 'I knew that you are a hard man, harvesting where you have not sown and gathering where you have not scattered seed.

verses.zh: 我就害怕，去把你的一千银子埋在地里。请看，你的原银子在这里。'
verses.en: So I was afraid and went out and hid your gold in the ground. See, here is what belongs to you.'

verses.zh: 主人回答说：'你这又恶又懒的仆人，你既知道我没有种的地方要收割，没有散的地方要聚敛，
verses.en: His master replied, 'You wicked, lazy servant! So you knew that I harvest where I have not sown and gather where I have not scattered seed?

verses.zh: 就当把我的银子放给兑换银钱的人，到我来的时候，可以连本带利收回。
verses.en: Well then, you should have put my money on deposit with the bankers, so that when I returned I would have received it back with interest.

verses.zh: 夺过他这一千来，给那有一万的。
verses.en: So take the bag of gold from him and give it to the one who has ten bags.

verses.zh: 因为凡有的，还要加给他，叫他有余；没有的，连他所有的也要夺过来。
verses.en: For whoever has will be given more, and they will have an abundance. Whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.

verses.zh: 把这无用的仆人丢在外面黑暗里；在那里必要哀哭切齿了。'
verses.en: And throw that worthless servant outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'

verses.zh: 当人子在他荣耀里，同着众天使降临的时候，要坐在他荣耀的宝座上。
verses.en: When the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, he will sit on his glorious throne.

verses.zh: 万民都要聚集在他面前。他要把他们分别出来，好像牧羊的分别绵羊山羊一般，
verses.en: All the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate the people one from another as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

verses.zh: 把绵羊安置在右边，山羊在左边。
verses.en: He will put the sheep on his right and the goats on his left.

verses.zh: 于是王要向那右边的说：'你们这蒙我父赐福的，可来承受那创世以来为你们所预备的国；
verses.en: Then the King will say to those on his right, 'Come, you who are blessed by my Father; take your inheritance, the kingdom prepared for you since the creation of the world.

verses.zh: 因为我饿了，你们给我吃，渴了，你们给我喝；我作客旅，你们留我住；
verses.en: For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in,

verses.zh: 我赤身露体，你们给我穿；我病了，你们看顾我；我在监里，你们来看我。'
verses.en: I needed clothes and you clothed me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to visit me.'

verses.zh: 义人就回答说：'主啊，我们什么时候见你饿了，给你吃，渴了，给你喝？
verses.en: Then the righteous will answer him, 'Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink?

verses.zh: 什么时候见你作客旅，留你住，或是赤身露体，给你穿？
verses.en: When did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or needing clothes and clothe you?

verses.zh: 又什么时候见你病了，或是在监里，来看你呢？'
verses.en: When did we see you sick or in prison and go to visit you?'

verses.zh: 王要回答说：'我实在告诉你们，这些事你们既做在我这弟兄中一个最小的身上，就是做在我身上了。'
verses.en: The King will reply, 'Truly I tell you, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers and sisters of mine, you did for me.'

verses.zh: 王又要向那左边的说：'你们这被咒诅的人，离开我！进入那为魔鬼和他的使者所预备的永火里去！
verses.en: Then he will say to those on his left, 'Depart from me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.

verses.zh: 因为我饿了，你们不给我吃，渴了，你们不给我喝；
verses.en: For I was hungry and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink,

verses.zh: 我作客旅，你们不留我住；我赤身露体，你们不给我穿；我病了，我在监里，你们不来看顾我。'
verses.en: I was a stranger and you did not invite me in, I needed clothes and you did not clothe me, I was sick and in prison and you did not look after me.'

verses.zh: 他们也要回答说：'主啊，我们什么时候见你饿了，或渴了，或作客旅，或赤身露体，或病了，或在监里，不伺候你呢？'
verses.en: They also will answer, 'Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or needing clothes or sick or in prison, and did not help you?'

verses.zh: 王要回答说：'我实在告诉你们，这些事你们既不做在我这弟兄中一个最小的身上，就是不做在我身上了。'
verses.en: He will reply, 'Truly I tell you, whatever you did not do for one of the least of these, you did not do for me.'

verses.zh: 这些人要往永刑里去；那些义人要往永生里去。
verses.en: Then they will go away to eternal punishment, but the righteous to eternal life.

verses.zh: 耶稣说完了这一切的话，就对门徒说：
verses.en: When Jesus had finished saying all these things, he said to his disciples,

verses.zh: '你们知道，过两天是逾越节，人子将要被交给人，钉在十字架上。'
verses.en: 'As you know, the Passover is two days away—and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified.'

verses.zh: 那时，祭司长和民间的长老聚集在大祭司称为该亚法的院里。
verses.en: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people assembled in the palace of the high priest, whose name was Caiaphas,

verses.zh: 大家商议要用诡计拿住耶稣，杀他，
verses.en: and they schemed to arrest Jesus secretly and kill him.

verses.zh: 只是说：'当节的日子不可，恐怕民间生乱。'
verses.en: 'But not during the festival,' they said, 'or there may be a riot among the people.'

verses.zh: 耶稣在伯大尼长大麻风的西门家里，
verses.en: While Jesus was in Bethany in the home of Simon the Leper,

verses.zh: 有一个女人拿着一玉瓶极贵的香膏来，趁耶稣坐席的时候，浇在他的头上。
verses.en: a woman came to him with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume, which she poured on his head as he was reclining at the table.

verses.zh: 门徒看见就很不喜悦，说：'何用这样的枉费呢！
verses.en: When the disciples saw this, they were indignant. 'Why this waste?' they asked.

verses.zh: 这香膏可以卖许多钱，赒济穷人。'
verses.en: 'This perfume could have been sold at a high price and the money given to the poor.'

verses.zh: 耶稣看出他们的意思，就说：'为什么难为这女人呢？她在我身上做的是一件美事。
verses.en: Aware of this, Jesus said to them, 'Why are you bothering this woman? She has done a beautiful thing to me.

verses.zh: 因为常有穷人和你们同在；只是你们不常有我。
verses.en: The poor you will always have with you, but you will not always have me.

verses.zh: 她将这香膏浇在我身上是为我安葬做的。
verses.en: When she poured this perfume on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，普天之下，无论在什么地方传这福音，也要述说这女人所做的，以为记念。'
verses.en: Truly I tell you, wherever this gospel is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told, in memory of her.'

verses.zh: 当下，十二门徒里有一个称为加略人犹大的，去见祭司长，说：
verses.en: Then one of the Twelve—the one called Judas Iscariot—went to the chief priests

verses.zh: '我把他交给你们，你们愿意给我多少钱？'他们就给了他三十块钱。
verses.en: and asked, 'What are you willing to give me if I deliver him over to you?' So they counted out for him thirty pieces of silver.

verses.zh: 从那时候，他就找机会要把耶稣交给他们。
verses.en: From then on Judas watched for an opportunity to hand him over.

verses.zh: 除酵节的第一天，门徒来问耶稣说：'你吃逾越节的筵席，要我们在哪里给你预备？'
verses.en: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus and asked, 'Where do you want us to make preparations for you to eat the Passover?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们进城去，到某人那里，对他说：夫子说：我的时候快到了，我与门徒要在你家里守逾越节。'
verses.en: He replied, 'Go into the city to a certain man and tell him, The Teacher says: My appointed time is near. I am going to celebrate the Passover with my disciples at your house.'

verses.zh: 门徒遵着耶稣所吩咐的，就去预备了逾越节的筵席。
verses.en: So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them and prepared the Passover.

verses.zh: 到了晚上，耶稣和十二个门徒坐席。
verses.en: When evening came, Jesus was reclining at the table with the Twelve.

verses.zh: 正吃的时候，耶稣说：'我实在告诉你们，你们中间有一个人要卖我了。'
verses.en: And while they were eating, he said, 'Truly I tell you, one of you will betray me.'

verses.zh: 他们就甚忧愁，一个一个地问他说：'主，是我吗？'
verses.en: They were very sad and began to say to him one after the other, 'Surely you don't mean me, Lord?'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'同我蘸手在盘子里的，就是他要卖我。
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'The one who has dipped his hand into the bowl with me will betray me.

verses.zh: 人子必要去世，正如经上指着他所写的；但卖人子的人有祸了！那人不生在世上倒好。'
verses.en: The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him. But woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man! It would be better for him if he had not been born.'

verses.zh: 卖耶稣的犹大问他说：'拉比，是我吗？'耶稣说：'你说的是。'
verses.en: Then Judas, the one who would betray him, said, 'Surely you don't mean me, Rabbi?' Jesus answered, 'You have said so.'

verses.zh: 他们吃的时候，耶稣拿起饼来，祝福，就擘开，递给门徒，说：'你们拿着吃，这是我的身体；'
verses.en: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to his disciples, saying, 'Take and eat; this is my body.'

verses.zh: 又拿起杯来，祝谢了，递给他们，说：'你们都喝这个；
verses.en: Then he took a cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, saying, 'Drink from it, all of you.

verses.zh: 因为这是我立约的血，为多人流出来，使罪得赦。
verses.en: This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.

verses.zh: 但我告诉你们，从今以后，我不再喝这葡萄汁，直到我在我父的国里同你们喝新的那日子。'
verses.en: I tell you, I will not drink from this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father's kingdom.'

verses.zh: 他们唱了诗，就出来往橄榄山去。
verses.en: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

verses.zh: 那时，耶稣对他们说：'今夜，你们为我的缘故都要跌倒。因为经上记着说：我要击打牧人，羊就分散了。
verses.en: Then Jesus told them, 'This very night you will all fall away on account of me, for it is written: I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.

verses.zh: 但我复活以后，要在你们以先往加利利去。'
verses.en: But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.'

verses.zh: 彼得说：'众人虽然为你的缘故跌倒，我却永不跌倒。'
verses.en: Peter replied, 'Even if all fall away on account of you, I never will.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'我实在告诉你，今夜鸡叫以先，你要三次不认我。'
verses.en: 'Truly I tell you,' Jesus answered, 'this very night, before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times.'

verses.zh: 彼得说：'我就是必须和你同死，也总不能不认你。'众门徒都是这样说。
verses.en: But Peter declared, 'Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you.' And all the other disciples said the same.

verses.zh: 耶稣同门徒来到一个地方，名叫客西马尼，就对他们说：'你们坐在这里，等我到那边去祷告。'
verses.en: Then Jesus went with his disciples to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to them, 'Sit here while I go over there and pray.'

verses.zh: 于是带着彼得和西庇太的两个儿子同去，就忧愁起来，极其难过，
