verses.en: He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee along with him, and he began to be sorrowful and troubled.

verses.zh: 便对他们说：'我心里甚是忧伤，几乎要死；你们在这里等候，和我一同警醒。'
verses.en: Then he said to them, 'My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with me.'

verses.zh: 他就稍往前走，俯伏在地，祷告说：'我父啊，倘若可行，求你叫这杯离开我。然而，不要照我的意思，只要照你的意思。'
verses.en: Going a little farther, he fell with his face to the ground and prayed, 'My Father, if it is possible, may this cup be taken from me. Yet not as I will, but as you will.'

verses.zh: 来到门徒那里，见他们睡着了，就对彼得说：'怎么样？你们不能同我警醒片时吗？
verses.en: Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping. 'Couldn't you men keep watch with me for one hour?' he asked Peter.

verses.zh: 总要警醒祷告，免得入了迷惑；你们心灵固然愿意，肉体却软弱了。
verses.en: Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.

verses.zh: 第二次又去祷告说：'我父啊，这杯若不能离开我，必要我喝，就愿你的意旨成全。'
verses.en: He went away a second time and prayed, 'My Father, if it is not possible for this cup to be taken away unless I drink it, may your will be done.'

verses.zh: 又来，见他们睡着了，因为他们的眼睛困倦。
verses.en: When he came back, he again found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy.

verses.zh: 耶稣又离开他们去了。第三次祷告，说的话还是与先前一样。
verses.en: So he left them and went away once more and prayed the third time, saying the same thing.

verses.zh: 于是来到门徒那里，对他们说：'现在你们仍然睡觉安歇吧（吧：或作吗）！时候到了，人子被卖在罪人手里了。
verses.en: Then he returned to the disciples and said to them, 'Are you still sleeping and resting? Look, the hour has come, and the Son of Man is delivered into the hands of sinners.

verses.zh: 起来！我们走吧。看哪，卖我的人近了！'
verses.en: Rise! Let us go! Here comes my betrayer!'

verses.zh: 说话之间，那十二个门徒里的犹大来了，并有许多人带着刀棒，从祭司长和民间的长老那里与他同来。
verses.en: While he was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived. With him was a large crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests and the elders of the people.

verses.zh: 那卖耶稣的给了他们一个暗号，说：'我与谁亲嘴，谁就是他。你们可以拿住他。'
verses.en: Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: 'The one I kiss is the man; arrest him.'

verses.zh: 犹大随即到耶稣跟前，说：'请拉比安'，就与他亲嘴。
verses.en: Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, 'Greetings, Rabbi!' and kissed him.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：'朋友，你来要做的事，就做吧。'于是那些人上前，下手拿住耶稣。
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'Do what you came for, friend.' Then the men stepped forward, seized Jesus and arrested him.

verses.zh: 有跟随耶稣的一个人伸手拔出刀来，将大祭司的仆人砍了一刀，削掉了他一个耳朵。
verses.en: With that, one of Jesus' companions reached for his sword, drew it out and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：'收刀入鞘吧！凡动刀的，必死在刀下。
verses.en: 'Put your sword back in its place,' Jesus said to him, 'for all who draw the sword will die by the sword.

verses.zh: 你想，我不能求我父现在为我差遣十二营多天使来吗？
verses.en: Do you think I cannot call on my Father, and he will at once put at my disposal more than twelve legions of angels?

verses.zh: 若是这样，经上所说，事情必须如此的话怎么应验呢？'
verses.en: But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that say it must happen in this way?'

verses.zh: 当时，耶稣对众人说：'你们带着刀棒出来拿我，如同拿强盗吗？我天天坐在殿里教训人，你们并没有拿我。
verses.en: In that hour Jesus said to the crowd, 'Am I leading a rebellion, that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me? Every day I sat in the temple courts teaching, and you did not arrest me.

verses.zh: 但这一切的事成就了，为要应验先知书上的话。'当下，门徒都离开他，逃走了。
verses.en: But this has all taken place that the writings of the prophets might be fulfilled.' Then all the disciples deserted him and fled.

verses.zh: 拿耶稣的人把他带到大祭司该亚法那里去；文士和长老已经在那里聚会。
verses.en: Those who had arrested Jesus took him to Caiaphas the high priest, where the teachers of the law and the elders had assembled.

verses.zh: 彼得远远地跟着耶稣，直到大祭司的院子，进到里面，就和差役同坐，要看这事到底怎样。
verses.en: But Peter followed him at a distance, right up to the courtyard of the high priest. He entered and sat down with the guards to see the outcome.

verses.zh: 祭司长和全公会寻找假见证控告耶稣，要治死他。
verses.en: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for false evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death.

verses.zh: 虽有好些人来作假见证，总得不着实据。末后有两个人前来，说：
verses.en: But they did not find any, though many false witnesses came forward. Finally two came forward

verses.zh: '这个人曾说：我能拆毁神的殿，三日内又建造起来。'
verses.en: and declared, 'This fellow said, I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.'

verses.zh: 大祭司就站起来，对耶稣说：'这些人作见证告你的是什么呢？你什么都不回答吗？'
verses.en: Then the high priest stood up and said to Jesus, 'Are you not going to answer? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you?'

verses.zh: 耶稣却不言语。大祭司对他说：'我指着永生神叫你起誓告诉我们，你是神的儿子基督不是？'
verses.en: But Jesus remained silent. The high priest said to him, 'I charge you under oath by the living God: Tell us if you are the Messiah, the Son of God.'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：'你说的是。然而，我告诉你们，后来你们要看见人子坐在那权能者的右边，驾着天上的云降临。'
verses.en: 'You have said so,' Jesus replied. 'But I say to all of you: From now on you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven.'

verses.zh: 大祭司就撕开衣服，说：'他说了僭妄的话，我们何必再用见证人呢？这僭妄的话，现在你们都听见了。
verses.en: Then the high priest tore his clothes and said, 'He has spoken blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? Look, now you have heard the blasphemy.

verses.zh: 你们的意见如何？'他们回答说：'他是该死的。'
verses.en: What do you think?' 'He is worthy of death,' they answered.

verses.zh: 他们就吐唾沫在他脸上，用拳头打他，也有用手掌打他的，说：
verses.en: Then they spit in his face and struck him with their fists. Others slapped him

verses.zh: '基督啊！你是先知，告诉我们打你的是谁？'
verses.en: and said, 'Prophesy to us, Messiah. Who hit you?'

verses.zh: 彼得在外面院子里坐着，有一个使女前来，说：'你素来也是同那加利利人耶稣一伙的。'
verses.en: Now Peter was sitting out in the courtyard, and a servant girl came to him. 'You also were with that Galilean, Jesus,' she said.

verses.zh: 彼得在众人面前却不承认，说：'我不知道你说的是什么！'
verses.en: But he denied it before them all. 'I don't know what you're talking about,' he said.

verses.zh: 既出去，到了门口，又有一个使女看见他，就对那里的人说：'这个人也是同拿撒勒人耶稣一伙的。'
verses.en: Then he went out to the gateway, where another servant girl saw him and said to the people there, 'This fellow was with Jesus of Nazareth.'

verses.zh: 彼得又不承认，并且起誓说：'我不认得那个人。'
verses.en: He denied it again, with an oath: 'I don't know the man!'

verses.zh: 过了不多的时候，旁边站着的人前来，对彼得说：'你真是他们一党的，你的口音把你露出来了。'
verses.en: After a little while, those standing there went up to Peter and said, 'Surely you are one of them; your accent gives you away.'

verses.zh: 彼得就发咒起誓地说：'我不认得那个人。'立时，鸡就叫了。
verses.en: Then he began to call down curses, and he swore to them, 'I don't know the man!' Immediately a rooster crowed.

verses.zh: 彼得想起耶稣所说的话：'鸡叫以先，你要三次不认我。'他就出去痛哭。
verses.en: Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken: 'Before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times.' And he went outside and wept bitterly.

verses.zh: 到了早晨，众祭司长和民间的长老大家商议要治死耶稣，
verses.en: Early in the morning, all the chief priests and the elders of the people made their plans how to have Jesus executed.

verses.zh: 就把他捆绑，解去，交给巡抚本丢彼拉多。
verses.en: So they bound him, led him away and handed him over to Pilate the governor.

verses.zh: 这时候，卖耶稣的犹大看见耶稣已经定了罪，就后悔，把那三十块钱拿回来给祭司长和长老，说：
verses.en: When Judas, who had betrayed him, saw that Jesus was condemned, he was seized with remorse and returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and the elders.

verses.zh: '我卖了无辜之人的血是有罪了。'他们说：'那与我们有什么相干？你自己承当吧！'
verses.en: 'I have sinned,' he said, 'for I have betrayed innocent blood.' 'What is that to us?' they replied. 'That's your responsibility.'

verses.zh: 犹大就把那银钱丢在殿里，出去吊死了。
verses.en: So Judas threw the money into the temple and left. Then he went away and hanged himself.

verses.zh: 祭司长拾起银钱来，说：'这是血价，不可放在库里。'
verses.en: The chief priests picked up the coins and said, 'It is against the law to put this into the treasury, since it is blood money.'

verses.zh: 他们商议，就用那银钱买了窑户的一块田，为要埋葬外乡人。
verses.en: So they decided to use the money to buy the potter's field as a burial place for foreigners.

verses.zh: 所以那块田直到今日还叫做血田。
verses.en: That is why it has been called the Field of Blood to this day.

verses.zh: 这就应验了先知耶利米的话，说：'他们用那三十块钱，就是被估定之人的价钱，是以色列人中所估定的，
verses.en: Then what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled: 'They took the thirty pieces of silver, the price set on him by the people of Israel,

verses.zh: 买了窑户的一块田；这是照着主所吅咐我的。'
verses.en: and they used them to buy the potter's field, as the Lord commanded me.'

verses.zh: 耶稣站在巡抚面前；巡抚问他说：'你是犹太人的王吗？'耶稣说：'你说的是。'
verses.en: Meanwhile Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, 'Are you the king of the Jews?' 'You have said so,' Jesus replied.

verses.zh: 他被祭司长和长老控告的时候，什么都不回答。
verses.en: When he was accused by the chief priests and the elders, he gave no answer.

verses.zh: 彼拉多就对他说：'他们作见证告你这么多的事，你没有听见吗？'
verses.en: Then Pilate asked him, 'Don't you hear the testimony they are bringing against you?'

verses.zh: 耶稣仍不回答，连一句话也不说，以致巡抚甚觉希奇。
verses.en: But Jesus made no reply, not even to a single charge—to the great amazement of the governor.

verses.zh: 巡抚有一个常例，每逢这节期，随众人所要的释放一个囚犯给他们。
verses.en: Now it was the governor's custom at the festival to release a prisoner chosen by the crowd.

verses.zh: 当时有一个名囚，叫做巴拉巴。
verses.en: At that time they had a well-known prisoner whose name was Jesus Barabbas.

verses.zh: 众人聚集的时候，彼拉多就对他们说：'你们要我释放哪一个给你们？是巴拉巴呢？是称为基督的耶稣呢？'
verses.en: So when the crowd had gathered, Pilate asked them, 'Which one do you want me to release to you: Jesus Barabbas, or Jesus who is called the Messiah?'

verses.zh: 巡抚原知道他们是因为嫉妒才把他解了来。
verses.en: For he knew it was out of self-interest that they had handed Jesus over to him.

verses.zh: 正坐堂的时候，他的夫人打发人来说：'这义人的事，你一点不可管；因为我今天在梦中为他受了许多的苦。'
verses.en: While Pilate was sitting on the judge's seat, his wife sent him this message: 'Don't have anything to do with that innocent man, for I have suffered a great deal today in a dream because of him.'

verses.zh: 祭司长和长老挑唤众人，求释放巴拉巴，除灭耶稣。
verses.en: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus executed.

verses.zh: 巡抚对众人说：'这两个人，你们要我释放哪一个给你们呢？'他们说：'巴拉巴。'
verses.en: 'Which of the two do you want me to release to you?' asked the governor. 'Barabbas,' they answered.

verses.zh: 彼拉多说：'那么，那称为基督的耶稣我怎么办他呢？'他们都说：'把他钉十字架！'
verses.en: 'What shall I do, then, with Jesus who is called the Messiah?' Pilate asked. They all answered, 'Crucify him!'

verses.zh: 巡抚说：'为什么呢？他做了什么恶事呢？'他们便极力地喊着说：'把他钉十字架！'
verses.en: 'Why? What crime has he committed?' asked Pilate. But they shouted all the louder, 'Crucify him!'

verses.zh: 彼拉多见说也无济，反要生乱，就拿水在众人面前洗手，说：'流这义人的血，罪不在我，你们承当吧。'
verses.en: When Pilate saw that he was getting nowhere, but that instead an uproar was starting, he took water and washed his hands in front of the crowd. 'I am innocent of this man's blood,' he said. 'It is your responsibility!'

verses.zh: 众人都回答说：'他的血归到我们和我们的子孙身上。'
verses.en: All the people answered, 'His blood is on us and on our children!'

verses.zh: 于是彼拉多释放了巴拉巴给他们，把耶稣鞭了，交给人钉十字架。
verses.en: Then he released Barabbas to them. But he had Jesus flogged, and handed him over to be crucified.

verses.zh: 巡抚的兵就把耶稣带进衢门，叫全营的兵都聚集在他那里。
verses.en: Then the governor's soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole company of soldiers around him.

verses.zh: 他们给他脱了衣服，穿上一件朱红色袍子，
verses.en: They stripped him and put a scarlet robe on him,

verses.zh: 用荆棘编做冠冕，戴在他头上，拿一根芦苇放在他右手里，跨在他面前，戏弄他，说：'恢对犹太人的王！'
verses.en: and then twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on his head. They put a staff in his right hand. Then they knelt in front of him and mocked him. 'Hail, king of the Jews!' they said.

verses.zh: 又吐唾沫在他脸上，拿芦苇打他的头。
verses.en: They spit on him, and took the staff and struck him on the head again and again.

verses.zh: 戏弄完了，就给他脱了袍子，仍穿上他自己的衣服，带他出去，要钉十字架。
verses.en: After they had mocked him, they took off the robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.

verses.zh: 他们出来的时候，遇见一个古利奈人，名叫西门，就勉强他同去，背着耶稣的十字架。
verses.en: As they were going out, they met a man from Cyrene, named Simon, and they forced him to carry the cross.

verses.zh: 到了一个地方名叫各各他，意思就是'髏髅地'。
verses.en: They came to a place called Golgotha (which means 'the place of the skull').

verses.zh: 兵丁拿苦胆调和的酒给耶稣喝。他尝了，就不肖喝。
verses.en: There they offered Jesus wine to drink, mixed with gall; but after tasting it, he refused to drink it.

verses.zh: 他们钉他在十字架上，就拈签分他的衣服，
verses.en: When they had crucified him, they divided up his clothes by casting lots.

verses.zh: 又坐在那里看守他。
verses.en: And sitting down, they kept watch over him there.

verses.zh: 在他头以上安一个牌子，写着他的罪状，说：'这是犹太人的王耶稣。'
verses.en: Above his head they placed the written charge against him: this is jesus, the king of the jews.

verses.zh: 当时，有两个强盗和他同钉十字架，一个在右边，一个在左边。
verses.en: Two rebels were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.

verses.zh: 从那里经过的人谩讬他，摇着头，说：
verses.en: Those who passed by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads

verses.zh: '你这拆毁圣殿、三日又建造起来的，可以救自己吧！你如果是神的儿子，就从十字架上下来吧！'
verses.en: and saying, 'You who are going to destroy the temple and build it in three days, save yourself! Come down from the cross, if you are the Son of God!'

verses.zh: 祭司长和文士并长老也是这样戏弄他，说：
verses.en: In the same way the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders mocked him.

verses.zh: '他救了别人，不能救自己。他是以色列的王，现在可以从十字架上下来，我们就信他。
verses.en: 'He saved others,' they said, 'but he can't save himself! He's the king of Israel! Let him come down now from the cross, and we will believe in him.

verses.zh: 他倒靠神，神若喜悦他，现在可以救他；因为他曾说：我是神的儿子。'
verses.en: He trusts in God. Let God rescue him now if he wants him, for he said, I am the Son of God.'

verses.zh: 那和他同钉的强盗也是这样的骂他。
verses.en: In the same way the rebels who were crucified with him also heaped insults on him.

verses.zh: 从午正到申初，遍地都黑暗了。
verses.en: From noon until three in the afternoon darkness came over all the land.

verses.zh: 约在申初，耶稣大声喊着说：'以利！以利！拉马撒巴各大尼！'就是说：'我的神！我的神！为什么离弃我？'
verses.en: About three in the afternoon Jesus cried out in a loud voice, 'Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?' (which means 'My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?').

verses.zh: 站在那里的人，有的听见就说：'这个人呼叫以利亚呢！'
verses.en: When some of those standing there heard this, they said, 'He's calling Elijah.'

verses.zh: 其中有一个人赶紧跑去，拿海绒蜡满了醋，绑在芦苇上，送给他喝。
verses.en: Immediately one of them ran and got a sponge. He filled it with wine vinegar, put it on a staff, and offered it to Jesus to drink.

verses.zh: 其余的人说：'且等着，看以利亚来救他不来。'
verses.en: The rest said, 'Now leave him alone. Let's see if Elijah comes to save him.'

verses.zh: 耶稣又大声喊叫，气就断了。
verses.en: And when Jesus had cried out again in a loud voice, he gave up his spirit.

verses.zh: 忽然，殿里的幔子从上到下裂为两半，地也震动，磐石也崩裂，
verses.en: At that moment the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom. The earth shook, the rocks split

verses.zh: 坟墓也开了，已睡圣徒的身体多有起来的。
verses.en: and the tombs broke open. The bodies of many holy people who had died were raised to life.

verses.zh: 到耶稣复活以后，他们从坟墓里出来，进了圣城，向许多人显现。
verses.en: They came out of the tombs after Jesus' resurrection and went into the holy city and appeared to many people.

verses.zh: 百夫长和一同看守耶稣的人看见地震并所经历的事，就极其害怕，说：这真是神的儿子了！
verses.en: When the centurion and those with him who were guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and all that had happened, they were terrified, and exclaimed, 'Surely he was the Son of God!'

verses.zh: 有好些妇女在那里，远远地观看；她们是从加利利跟随耶稣来服侍他的。
verses.en: Many women were there, watching from a distance. They had followed Jesus from Galilee to care for his needs.

verses.zh: 内中有抹大拉的马利亚，又有雅各和约西的母亲马利亚，并有西庇太两个儿子的母亲。
verses.en: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee's sons.

verses.zh: 到了晚上，有一个亚利马太的财主，名叫约瑟，也是耶稣的门徒。
verses.en: As evening approached, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who had himself become a disciple of Jesus.

verses.zh: 这人去见彼拉多，求耶稣的身体；彼拉多就呉咐给他。
verses.en: Going to Pilate, he asked for Jesus' body, and Pilate ordered that it be given to him.

verses.zh: 约瑟取了身体，用干净的细麻布裹好，
verses.en: Joseph took the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

verses.zh: 安放在自己的新坟墓里，就是他在磐石里凿出来的。他又把大石头滚到坟墓门口，就去了。
verses.en: and placed it in his own new tomb that he had cut out of the rock. He rolled a big stone in front of the entrance to the tomb and went away.

verses.zh: 有抹大拉的马利亚和那个马利亚在那里，对着坟墓坐着。
verses.en: Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting there opposite the tomb.

verses.zh: 次日，就是预备日的第二天，祭司长和法利赛人聚集来见彼拉多，说：
verses.en: The next day, the one after Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees went to Pilate.

verses.zh: '大人，我们记得那迷惑人还活着的时候曾说：三日后我要复活。
verses.en: 'Sir,' they said, 'we remember that while he was still alive that deceiver said, After three days I will rise again.

verses.zh: 因此，请吹咐人把守墓直到第三日，恐怕他的门徒来，把他偷了去，就告诉百姓说：他从死里复活了。这样，那后来的迷惑比先前的更利害了！'
verses.en: So give the order for the tomb to be made secure until the third day. Otherwise, his disciples may come and steal the body and tell the people that he has been raised from the dead. This last deception will be worse than the first.'

verses.zh: 彼拉多说：'你们有看守的兵，去吧！尽你们所能的把守牢了。'
verses.en: 'Take a guard,' Pilate answered. 'Go, make the tomb as secure as you know how.'

verses.zh: 他们就带着看守的兵同去，封了石头，将坟墓把守牢了。
verses.en: So they went and made the tomb secure by putting a seal on the stone and posting the guard.
